ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

Anti-Balaka militiamen ambushed a Chadian patrol, killing one officer and wounding several soldiers. 33 deaths, including civilians.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes between Congolese soldiers of MISCA and Anti-Balaka left two people dead in Loppo village, near Nola. The MISCA soldiers had come to the area to encourage populations to return to their homes following prior clashes in the area.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A firefight broke out between the Anti-Balaka and the Cameroonian contingent of MINUSCA, which resulted in MINUSCA arresting General Andjilo of the Anti-Balaka.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Spanish convoy of the EUFOR-RCA force exchanged fire with an armed man and a Muslim militia in Bangui. The armed man was shot and injured and one minor injury on the part of the armed Muslims reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: EUFOR-RCA revisit the scene of the confrontation in Kokoro for investigation. A rocket is fired at their convoy, causing them to fire warning shots. No casualties.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Former Seleka fighters and armed pastoralists attacked the Ngakobo IDP site. UN peacekeepers secured the site and repelled the attack. 7 civilians were wounded during the fighting.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Fulani Ethnic Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Former Seleka rebels attacked a sugar factory in Ngakobo where IDPs were seeking refuge, which is guarded by Congolese peacekeepers in Ngakobo. One of the attackers, a Fulani, was killed, while several other people were wounded. The attackers fired rockets at the sugar factory.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Burundian soldier was killed by 'one of his comrades' in their lodgings at Bangui.

ACTOR1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Xinhua; RFI; AFP; Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: 7 rebels were killed, 9 wounded, and 20 arrested in clashes between FPRC elements of the Seleka militia and French/MINUSCA forces. The international forces notably carried our air raids on FPRC positions. MINUSCA forces claim to have taken control of public buildings formerly controlled by Seleka forces.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: French forces responded to violence by armed individuals in the Boy Rabe neighbourhood of Bangui. They came under small arms and grenade attacks. MINUSCA and Central African Republic police forces joined French forces in dealing with the violence. At least 3 students and 1 French soldier were wounded during the fighting.

ACTOR1: Kaga-Bandoro Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: ReliefWeb; UN (unspecified); RCA (Central African Republic); Centrafrique Presse Info
NOTES: Around 400 residents of Kaga Bandoro armed with knives and other weapons attacked the MINUSCA base during protests to demand protection from armed Fulani who have recently attacked nearby villages. Gunfire was exchanged outside the base, while demonstrators threw stones and other objects at MINSUCA peacekeepers and attempted to set the camp on fire. Warning shots were fired by the peacekeepers. At least one protester was killed, and more than 12 people were wounded. Some reports have the number as high as 3.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After the end of the Bangui Forum, what started as peaceful protests to demand the release of an anti-Balaka leader and the resignation of the president turned into riots as angry anti-Balaka leaders felt their demands were not being taken into account. Gunfire was heard, grenades went off, and barricades were raised, while MINUSCA forces responded with tear gas. Some witnesses reported anti-Balaka and former Seleka protesting together.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
NOTES: A Burundian MINUSCA contingent and Anti-Balaka forces reportedly engaged in a heavy exchange of gunfire in the 4th District (Boganda) area of Bangui near a high school after an allege failed arrest of a Anti-Balaka leader in the area. 2 peacekeepers were injured along with as many as 40 high school students who were caught in the crossfire. The MINUSCA forces claimed that the Anti-Balaka gunmen used the students as human shields.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016)
NOTES: National and international forces launched an 'aggressive operation' against gunmen camped near Zoukombo who have ambushed commercial vehicles and attacked villagers in the Baboua area. 6 civilian hostages killed (circumstances unclear) and one released, one person arrested, and livestock recovered during the operation.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: A convoy of WFP supplies escorted by MINUSCA peacekeepers was attacked, resulting in the death of one of the drivers and injured others.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: AFP; RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: A group of unidentified gunmen opened fire on a Bangladeshi MINUSCA patrol in Diba, near Beloko. At least 2 MINUSCA peacekeepers were injured.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016)
NOTES: At least 1 MINUSCA peacekeeper was killed and several others wounded in fighting which erupted when the peacekeepers, backed by CAR police, attempted to arrest an unidentified faction leader in PK5.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Seleka Militia
NOTES: 4 militiamen and 1 Cameroonian MINUSCA peacekeeper were killed in a clash with communal militia in the KM5 neighbourhood of Bangui as the peacekeepers attempted to arrest a former Seleka rebel commander. 8 other people were wounded according to MSF. Exchanges of fire were again heard between the two groups the following morning but no mentioned casualty.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Exchanges of fire between MINUSCA soldiers and KM5 militia looking for their leader in KM5 area of Bangui after clashes that left 5 dead the day before. No reported casualty this time.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Rwandan soldier of MINUSCA opened fire on his colleagues, killing 4 other Rwandan soldiers, in their base in Bangui. He was also killed during the gunfight while 8 other soldiers were wounded. The reason behind the shooting was unclear.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Pastoralists (Central African Republic)
NOTES: At least 5 people were killed and 8 injured in intercommunal clashes between Fulani and Anti-Balaka in the Bria mining community. UN forces intervened to help stop the violence.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Rwandan MINUSCA forces were ambushed in the 4th district of Bangui by unidentified assailants armed with heavy weapons which caused 'extensive damage' to their armoured vehicles. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: An attempt to dismantle barricades erected in the 8th district of Bangui led to a clash between the unidentified controllers of the barricades and MINUSCA elements. The violence reportedly also spread to the 3rd and 5th districts. At least 1 civilian was killed, although no official death toll was given (coded as 10 across the 3 events).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: An attempt to dismantle barricades erected in the 8th district of Bangui led to a clash between the unidentified controllers of the barricades and MINUSCA elements. The violence reportedly also spread to the 3rd and 5th districts. At least 1 civilian was killed, although no official death toll was given (coded as 10 across the 3 events).

NOTES: An attempt to dismantle barricades erected in the 8th district of Bangui led to a clash between the unidentified controllers of the barricades and MINUSCA elements. The violence reportedly also spread to the 3rd and 5th districts. At least 1 civilian was killed, although no official death toll was given.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen opened fire on the MINSUCA HQ in Bangui, prompting a return of fire from MINUSCA forces. The attackers then fled on a motorcycle. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Burundian MINUSCA peacekeeper was killed during an attack by an unidentified group on a convoy traveling between Damaraand Ngerengou. Another was also injured by the attackers.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Centrafrique Presse Info; RFI; RCA (Central African Republic)
NOTES: MINUSCA and French forces clashed just outside the Sibut area with FPRC elements of the Seleka militia who were marching on Bangui. The clashes continued from Oct.10-11. Helicopters bombed Seleka positions during the fighting. 10 Seleka were killed over the 2 days of fighting.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
SOURCE: RFI; Centrafrique Presse Info; RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo)
NOTES: MINUSCA and French forces clashed just outside the Sibut area with FPRC elements of the Seleka militia who were marching on Bangui. The clashes continued from Oct.10-11. Helicopters bombed Seleka positions during the fighting. 10 Seleka were killed over the 2 days of fighting.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; Xinhua; RFI; UN (unspecified)
NOTES: 7 UN police were kidnapped by a 50 member anti-Balaka force and disarmed near Boali before being released in the evening after negotiations with the government. Armaments were also returned a week later after negotiations.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: 3 unidentified gunmen attacked a MINUSCA forces post in Damara. 1 assailant was killed when the peacekeepers returned fire, while the other two escaped.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UN: United Nations
NOTES: Anti-Balaka forces fired shots near Fatima Church in Banguis 6th district during a visit by the special representative of the UN Secretary-General. Peacekeepers returned fire but no casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINSUCA reported that a convoy it was protecting came under attack in the 4th district of Bangui, injuring 3 people, including 2 peacekeepers.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: During clashes between anti-Balaka and ex-Seleka forces near a MINUSCA outpost, at least one Cameroonian peacekeeper was killed. It was not clear who killed the peackeeper.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Central African Republic)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka; UNHCR
NOTES: UPC forces attacked the IDP site at 'St. Joseph' in Bambari, but were stopped by the Congolese contingent of MINUSCA. At least 4 civilians were killed, several injured and more than 30 tents burned by the attackers.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA forces intervened during an ex-Seleka attack on the Ngaboko IDP camp, killing 5 fighters during the clash. 2 Seleka fighters were also injured, as well as 1 peacekeeper.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A MINUSCA peacekeeper was injured in Bria during violence that took place during the voting on the constitutional referendum.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PK5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
NOTES: At least 5 people were killed and 20 injured, including 2 peacekeepers, during fighting which broke out in PK5 during voting over the constitutional referendum (split between multiple events in PK5). During the fighting, MINUSCA peacekeepers were deployed to protect poll workers and residents while they cast their votes near a school. Machine gun fire and RPG explosions were heard during the violence. In one incident, a Muslim self-defense militia fought with a group of anti-referendum former Seleka fighters outside a school where voting was taking place.

ACTOR1: Agoumar Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-)
NOTES: After a communal group in Agoumar captured an LRA member, MINUSCA forces intervened when community members attempted to kill the rebel. This led to a clash, leading to at least 1 Moroccan peacekeeper and 1 civilian seriously injured. Both of those injured later died.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: RJ: Revolution and Justice
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After an ex-Seleka member attempted to stab a trader over a personal dispute, MINUSCA forces intervened and 'won the battle', arresting at least one Seleka member after the incident. More Seleka forces entered the town but eventually left after MINUSCA patrols were stepped up. The area is considered a stronghold of the RJ faction of the former Seleka.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
SOURCE: Cameroon Tribune; Xinhua; RFI; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); AFP
NOTES: Bangladeshi MINUSCA peacekeepers and national forces clashed with a local self-defense group in the PK5 area of Bangui after they allegedly attacked a police station. The results of the clash 1 peacekeeper was injured by a grenade and at least 3 fatalities were reported among the attackers. 3 people were also arrested. It was also reported that MINUSCA peacekeepers had gone to PK5 to secure the release of police officers leading to fatalities, but it was not clear whether the police station attack was in retaliation or prompted the MINUSCA action.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Senegalese MINUSCA peacekeeper was killed by unidentified armed assailants

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
NOTES: Around 35 heavily-armed former Seleka rebels were intercepted by MINUSCA in Sibut, resulting in 2 Seleka fighters killed, some injuries, and 10 captured. These were allegedly part of the group affiliated with the FPRC which illegally left Bangui the night before.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: The forces of minusca expelled about 200 heavily armed men from Boguila. The identity and affiliation of the armed men is not mentioned. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: RPRC: Patriotic Movement for the Rebirth of the Central African People
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: RPRC members attacked an IDP camp and clashed with MINUSCA forces in and around Kaga-Bandoro. A helicopter flight and reinforcements were dispatched to support the peacekeepers. At least 12 attackers and a number of civilians were reported killed in the violence which occurred during clashes between the ex-Seleka and peacekeeping forces. In total, the violence in the city resulted in 37 killed and at least 57 wounded (10 fatalities coded in another event).

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A clash broke out in Gbakomalekpa, near Bambari, after anti-Balaka forces stopped a civilian convoy carrying livestock which was protected by MINUSCA peacekeepers and demanded money, which the peacekeepers refused to pay. 2 anti-Balaka fighters and a civilian were killed, while 3 civilians and 5 peacekeepers were injured in the resulting violence.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Six UN policemen and four civilians were killed Friday morning during an ambush on the Bambari-Grimari axis. A child of seven was wounded and is being treated by peacekeepers Mauritanian.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: Two civilians died and one peacekeeper was seriously injured in an attack by an armed group on a convoy on Grimari Bambari-axis. Anti-Balaka is accused of the attack while they denied any responsibility.

ACTOR1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A UN camp in Bria came under fire by FPRC fighters during unrest in the city. MINUSCA forces returned fire and repulsed the attackers.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked MINUSCA peacekeepers protecting an IDP camp in the Kaga-Bandoro area. No casualties were reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: Ex-Seleka members of the RJ and UPC attacked a gendarmerie station in Paoua. MINUSCA peacekeepers came to their aid and assisted in repelling the attack.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: AFP; Maghreb Emergent; RCA (Central African Republic)
NOTES: 2 Moroccan peacekeepers were killed in an attack by unidentified gunmen on a MINUSCA convoy traveling in the Mboki area. 2 soldiers were also injured.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA fighters were attacked in the Bocaranga area by Anti-Balaka fighters, resulting in at least one Bangladeshi peacekeeper killed. RRR forces were also reported in the area, but it was not clear if they participated in the event.

ACTOR1: PK5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)

NOTES: The leader of a PK5 militia, Youssouf Sy (aka Big Man), one of his fighters and 2 civilians were killed during a joint operation by MINUSCA and CAR gendarmerie in the PK5 neighbourhood of Bangui. 3 gendarmerie personnel were also injured in the raid.

ACTOR1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa

NOTES: MINUSCA peacekeepers clashed with FPRC fighters near Ippy, killing one and wounding another.

NOTES: 4 MINUSCA peacekeepers were injured, one seriously, in a clash with FPRC fghters near Ippy.

NOTES: A Senegalese peacekeeper was injured by unidentified assailants in Bangui, and later died of his wounds in hospital.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After MINUSCA forces intervened in a clash between Anti-Balaka and former Seleka forces, Anti-Balaka members allegedly opened fire on them, resulting in 1 killed, 2 wounded and 9 arrested among the assailants and one civilian wounded.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
NOTES: 01 April. MINUSCA and military forces of CAR rescued 15 people abducted by LRA from Koubou village. The location of the recovery is not known. Clash assumed.

ACTOR1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: UPC fighters attacked the city of Zemio and the MINUSCA base there. 2 UPC were killed and several wounded during the incident.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Suspected Abs attacked a MINUSCA convoy travelling through the village of Youngofongo between Bangassou and Rafai. The attack resulted in the deaths of five peacekeepers (four Cambodians and one Moroccan) and left another ten wounded (nine Moroccans and one Cambodian). Eight 'anti-Balaka' attackers were killed and several wounded in the crossfire, according to MINUSCA.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; RCA (Central African Republic)
NOTES: MINUSCA base was attacked by armed men associated to Anti-Balaka. MINSUCA sent helicopter and air-strikes to counter them. Civilians left the city to take shelter in church or in the countryside. 12 killed. Later on, Anti-Balaka denied their involvement in the clashes, stating that possibly foreign mercenaries have to be held responsible. In the meanwhile, the overall account of clashes grew to 32 dead and 44 wounded. On May, 18th, the Red Cross stated the dead were 115.

SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: United Nations peacekeeping forces in Central African Republic retook strategic points of Bangassou Monday after armed rebels attacked over the weekend.

NOTES: Clashes between MINUSCA and Anti Balakas were reported on the Bangassou-Bakouma axis; 5 ABs were killed and 2 blue helmets were wounded.

NOTES: MINUSCA was attacked twice in a week on the Kongbo-Mobaye axis and around Mobaye

NOTES: One anti-balaka militiaman was wounded in clashes with MINUSCA soldiers.

NOTES: On 1 April, LRA forces attacked the Koubou village, Obo, taking 15 civilians as hostages and looting goods. One hostage died after the events. 9 hostages were freed by the LRA on 4 April.

NOTES: On 9 February 2021, armed elements of the CPC coalition and the FPRC ambushed a convoy of MINUSCA peacekeepers, leaving 2 injured, about 24 km from Bangassou (Mbomou, Bangassou).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)

ACTOR2: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: On 12 February 2021, military forces, supported by MINUSCA and Russian private soldiers, took over the city of Bambari (Bambari, Ouaka) and pushed CPC and UPC rebels to villages outside the city.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Wagner Group; MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change
SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: Around 14 February 2021 (as reported), military forces supported by Russian Wagner and MINUSCA took control over the mining town of Ndassima (Bambari, Ouaka), following clashes with the CPC rebels who then withdrew. It is unclear which rebel group was involved in the fighting. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-); Wagner Group
ACTOR2: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: On 15 February 2021, military forces, supported by Russian soldiers and Rwandan MINUSCA forces, clashed with UPC members, part of the CPC rebels, in Bambari (Bambari, Ouaka). The government forces took over control of the city the next day (coded separately). During the 2 days of clashes, at least 15 people were killed (with reports indicating 18 killed and about 40 wounded. Fatalities divided into 2 events.

NOTES: On 16 February 2021, military forces, supported by Russian soldiers and Rwandan MINUSCA forces, clashed with UPC members, part of the CPC rebels, in Bambari (Bambari, Ouaka) regaining the control of the city after clashes that started the previous day. During the 2 days of clashes, at least 15 people were killed (with reports indicating 18 killed and about 40 wounded. Fatalities divided into 2 events.

NOTES: Around 5 March 2021 (as reported), following clashes with CPC rebels, military forces supported by Wagner fighters and Rwandan MINUSCA forces took over the village of Nassole (Berberati, Mambere-Kadei). No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.

NOTES: On 8 March 2021, military forces, Wagner fighters and MINUSCA forces regained control of the town of Kouango (Kouango, Ouaka), following a 2-hours long offensive against the CPC rebels, who had held it for more than 7 years. Rebels reportedly dispersed into the bush, others headed for neighboring towns on motorcycles.

ACTOR1: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change

NOTES: On 8 March 2021, CPC rebels ambushed a convoy of MINUSCA soldiers, government forces and Wagner in the village of Manga (Bozoum, Ouham Pende), on the highway between Bozoum and Bocaranga. 2 Russian Wagner fighters were reportedly killed and a vehicle destroyed. It is unclear which rebel group was involved in the attack.

ACTOR1: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change

NOTES: On 15 April 2021, the Central African armed forces supported by MINUSCA and Wagner Group fighters retook control over the city of Kabo (Kabo, Ouham). Rebels retreated further north towards the border with Chad. It is unclear which rebel group was involved. No casualties were reported.

NOTES: On 26 June 2021, an unidentified armed group attacked various military and MINUSCA bases, clashing with FACA, gendarmerie and peacekeepers, in Obo (Haut-Mbomou). There were two fatalities, one among FACA and one civilian; one peacekeeper was injured.

SOURCE: Corbeau News; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: On 28 June 2021, UPC rebels from CPC stormed the city and clashed with national military forces and gendarmerie, supported by MINUSCA troops, in Alindao (Basse-Kotto). Seven fatalities were reported, two from gendarmerie and two from civilians, split between two events. Security forces managed to maintain control over the city.

ACTOR1: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme; Twitter; aBangui; ReliefWeb
NOTES: On 27 July 2021, UPC rebels from CPC attacked a MINUSCA base, in order to free imprisoned militiamen, in Obo (Haut-Mbomou). UN troops responded to the attack, supported by FACA, and clashed with the rebels, which were then rejected. One peacekeeper was wounded, three rebels and a FACA officer were killed. Four fatalities were reported in total.

ACTOR2: CPC: Coalition of Patriots for Change
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
NOTES: On 13 August 2021, MINUSCA peacekeepers clashed with the UPC rebels from CPC, after international forces tried to arrest an UPC member, in Zemio (Haut-Mbomou). There were no fatalities nor injuries.

NOTES: Around 8 September 2021 (week of), Wagner Group forces opened fire against Senegalese troops under MINUSCA at the Berberati aerodrome (Berberati, Mambere-Kadei), ordering the group to turn back. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

NOTES: Around 4 November 2021 (week of), MINUSCA peacekeepers clashed with an unidentified armed group, partially composed of ex-Seleka militiamen, in various locations in the Ouham prefecture (coded as Nana-Bakassa). There were no fatalities nor injuries.

NOTES: On 2 December 2021, the UPC and Seleka rebels from CPC attacked the FACA and police positions, clashing with them and overtaking the city, in Kouango (Ouaka). After advancing into the city, MINUSCA peacekeepers intervened and clashed with rebels. One police officer and a woman were killed, and some civilians were injured. The rebels left the city the following day.

ACTOR1: FAPC: Peoples Armed Forces of Congo
ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: MONUC and FAPC fighters traded fire in Ndere camp near the Ituri province town of Mahagi, killing two militiamen, and wounding at least two U.N. troops and one civilian. MONUC troops occupied the base. The clash occurred as MONUC tried to investigate reports of a mass grave holding victims of the militia, including child combatants allegedly killed when they wanted to give up their weapons under a U.N.-led disarmament campaign. 100 militiamen fled to nearby forests.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Lobala Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Democratic Republic of Congo forces exchanged fire on Sunday with around 100 tribal insurgents in Mbandaka in Equateur. A UN soldier from Ghana was killed. The assailants received support from former soldiers of the DSP (Praetorian Guard of late President Mobutu), elements of the former army of Zaire, the DPP (personal bodyguards of former Deputy President Jean-Pierre Bemba currently in detention at the International Criminal Court) and a few demobilized persons. The assailants also claim to be part of the Liberation Movement of Independent Allies, whose chairman is Ibrahim Mangbama and its military chief Undjani, a son of Ibrahim. These names were mentioned at the start of the insurrection in Dongo in October 2009.

NOTES: A mob surrounded UN compound and some opened fire on UN Peacekeeping troops, others throwing stones. 7 Pakistani peacekeepers were injured. The crowd was apparently protesting against attacks in the region carried out by Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda rebels, Nesirky told a briefing.The UN mission in DR Congo reported that 'elements' of a Mai-Mai group, the Rai Mutomboki, 'may have been part of the protest and may have fired on the peacekeepers,' The Rai Mutomboki are an armed self-defense group.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO soldiers have recovered all bases controlled by the FNL on the Uvira plateaus, and specifically around the town of Ruhoha. No casualties were taken by the joint forces, while casualties for the FNL were not reported. Provisional casualties were announced at 2 FNL fighters dead and 29 wounded during the operation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
NOTES: On 10 January 2015, FARDC and MONUSCO forces took control of the Pilot and Issa camps of the ADF in Virungu National Park, near Halungupa (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: Fighting began between FARDC soldiers and FRPI militiamen in the village of Aveba, and spread to other villages in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi (in Ituri), including Tchekele, Kaswara and Bavi. Thousands of people were displaced during the fighting. In Aveba, UN helicopters assisted the Congolese forces, and at least 14 FRPI and 6 FARDC soldiers were reported dead in Aveba.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Shetani)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: The Charles and Shetani Mayi Mayi militias attacked the MONUSCO intervention brigade in the Kisharo area, which responded. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A MONUSCO helicopter was fired at by unidentified gunmen from a field near Oicha. No casualties were reported, but bullet holes were observed on the helicopter.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: 2 Tanzanian MONUSCO peacekeepers were killed and 26 others injured in an ambush by alleged ADF rebels near the Mavivi Mayimoya intersection in the Oicha area near where a helicopter was attacked the day before. 4 peacekeepers who went missing during the attack were later found. However, a UN group of experts report accuses Congolese soldiers of causing the casualties, as they believed the Tanzanian peacekeepers had been supplying weapons to the ADF.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: FARDC soldiers engaged in an offensive against all FRPI positions in Aveba, successfully dislodging them and capturing the area, reportedly causing heavy casualties. MONUSCO helicopters and peacekeepers patrolled during the operation to ensure the safety of civilians.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: On Jun.16, it was reported that heavy fighting had been ongoing in the Walendu Bindi area between FARDC soldiers and FRPI militiamen for the past 10 days, resulting in over 17,000 displaced. Fighting is part of a joint operation with MONUSCO forces.

NOTES: Following an attack on a motorcycle, ADF rebels clashed with a joint FARDC-MONUSCO force on the Semuliki River bridge. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
NOTES: During ongoing operations by FARDC soldiers and the APCLS, the commander of a MONUSCO operational base was wounded during a patrol.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: MONUSCO airstrikes have been launched in the Pinga area, in coordination with ground operations by FARDC, targeting the NDC. They claim to have killed 1 member of an armed group, and injured at least 4 others, and to have not caused any civilian casualties. Other sources claimed 4-5 civilians had been killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces launched a joint offensive against the ADF in the Beni territory, including attacks on ADF forces in the Eringeti and Oicha areas with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces launched a joint offensive against the ADF in the Beni territory, including attacks on ADF forces in the Eringeti and Oicha areas with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 5 people were killed during an attack by ADF rebels on FARDC positions. The FARDC soldiers were reinforced by MONUSCO forces during the fighting.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua; Le Potentiel; AP; MONUSCO
NOTES: ADF rebels dislodged FARDC soldiers from at least part of Eringeti on Nov.29 before being pushed out a few hours later on Nov.30. The rebels attack stretched from Makembi to Eringeti and simultaneously targeted a FARDC position, a MONUSCO base, a hospital in Eringeti, and the office of the PNC in Beni territory. 1 UN peacekeeper, 7 soldiers, 10 civilians and 21 rebels were killed, while 1 peacekeeper and 4 soldiers were injured. 5 more people believe to have been killed during the fighting were found a few days later. During the violence at least 43 homes were also burned. At least 2,000 people ahve fled following the fighting.

NOTES: According to a FARDC spokesman, FARDC soldiers supported by MONUSCO forces have engaged in attacks against FRPI positions in the localities of Mukato, Mabili, Tchanda, and Avelulu Semuliki in Ituri territory. No casualties have been reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A MONUSCO helicopter was hit by ADF gunfire near Eringiti. There were no casualties and little damage.

NOTES: At least 2 ADF rebels were killed during a simultaneous attack by the ADF on FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Opira area of beni territory. At least 5 soldiers were seriously injured, with 4 dying of their wounds the next day.

NOTES: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

NOTES: MONUSCO forces came to the aid of Kihondo IDP camp after Mayi Mayi Nyatura fighters attempted to rob its residents, leading to a clash.

NOTES: Suspected FDLR rebels fired on a MONUSCO vehicle as it traveled from Luofu to Kaseke.

NOTES: About 20 ADF rebels attacked a FARDC position in Mayimoya. MONUSCO forces came to the FARDC soldiers aid and killed 3 ADF soldiers befor the clash ended.

ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A helicopter from the South African contingent of MONUSCO came under fire from an unidentified armed group as it was flying towards Goma. The helicopter was damaged but no injuries were reported.

NOTES: ADF forces attacked FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. The attack occurred near a bridge that led towards Uganda. Many ADF were reportedly wounded.

NOTES: Congolese soldiers backed by MONUSCO have dislodged ADF rebels from several camps in the area around Beni where the 'Usalama' operation is ongoing. 23 ADF rebels were also reported killed since the beginning of the operation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
NOTES: 14 FARDC soldiers and 37 ADF rebels have been killed in operations against the ADF since May (the deaths of 6 ADF rebels and 1 soldier coded in another event). 15 other rebels were captured, along with weapons and ammunitions and some roadside bombs. MONUSCO supported FARDC in these operations. One of the ADF rebels killed was the 2nd in command of the group (killed on June 13, coded in another event).

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 16 June. MONUSCO troops engaged Mayi-Mayi elements who had been trying to impede the distribution of food by humanitarians to internally displaced persons, resulting in the death of nine Mayi-Mayi elements.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: At least 7 NDC-R militiamen were killed and 11 others wounded in a clash with South African MONUSCO peacekeepers and FARDC soldiers in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. They were allegedly trying to prevent food distribution to IDPs.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
NOTES: FARDC soldiers dismantled an FDLR position in the Kazaroho area during operations supported by MONUSCO. They also captured arms and released 6 people kidnapped on the Kibirizi-Rwindi road.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 30 June. FARDC, with MONUSCO support, clashed with suspected Allied Democratic Forces elements east of Oicha. Two FARDC soldiers were killed and another two were wounded, and one MONUSCO peacekeeper was slightly injured. Three presumed elements of that group were killed and two were captured by FARDC.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: 13 August. On 13 and 14 July, in response to cooperation between Congolese security forces and MONUSCO that aimed at preventing illegal activities in Virunga National Park, Mayi-Mayi Charles elements fired at MONUSCO helicopters and burned down a FARDC post near the park.

NOTES: 7 people were killed in an attack by the ADF on Oicha, which was repulsed by Congolese soldiers and MONUSCO peacekeepers. Among those killed were 2 civilians, 3 attackers and 2 soldiers. A MONUSCO peacekeeper was also wounded and 3 ADF rebels captured.

NOTES: 11 FARDC soldiers and a MONUSCO peacekeeper were wounded during operations against ADF rebels in the Beni area. A helicopter dispatched to recover the wounded came under fire and had to turn back. They were successfully evacuated the next day.

ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
NOTES: FARDC soldiers backed by MONUSCO have engaged in clashes with ADF rebels in the south Eringeti area since the beginning of an operation against them on Aug.8, which has resulted in an unconfirmed number of ADF rebels killed (coded as 10). 3 soldiers were also killed, and another 3 wounded.

NOTES: Congolese soldiers clashed with Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Nyanzale area between Dec.4-5. MONUSCO peacekeepers came to the aid of the FARDC soldiers with heavy artillery. Casualties were not reported.

NOTES: An armed group attacked a FARDC position in Rwangoma, a district of Beni town. The group was repelled by the FARDC and MONUSCO forces. 13 of the Mayi Mayi militia were killed, 13 were captured, and 6 were wounded.

NOTES: Unidentified armed men (later confirmed as a Mayi Mayi Militia) attacked the MONUSCO base in Mulo in central Lubero. Reports mention that 2 or 3 of the attackers were killed and 2 blue helmets were injured.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A MONUSCO base in Mamundioma, Beni, was attacked by the ADF on October 9th. It was the second attack on a MONUSCO base in less than a week. There were 2 casualties on MONUSCO's side. MONUSCO immediately deployed forces with attack helicopters in order to secure the area. One report mentions that 10 people were killed and that at least 22 are missing. 12 other soldiers were hurt.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: The FRPI clashed with MONUSCO in Tshanda, 10 km away from Geti, injuring according do one source 3 blue helmets, and according to the UN only 2. 2 civilians were also hurt during the clash, which lasted 15 hours.

NOTES: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fatalities spread over events.

NOTES: Violent clashes broke out in Beni between the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, and the ADF in Beni, over attempts to gain the control of the route that connects Kamango to surrounding localities. At least one rebel was killed. 3 soldiers were wounded and 1 is missing.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Clashes between Congolese troops and supporters of a renegade colonel (Abbas Kayonga) in Congo's eastern city of Bukavu killed seven people on Sunday before he surrendered and turned himself in to U.N. Peacekeepers. Seventeen members of Kanyonga's force surrendered to U.N. troops and nine others were captured by the army. A dozen weapons were captured. Two army soldiers and three of Kayonga's bodyguards were killed in the fighting and two civilians were killed by stray bullets, he said. Another later report mentions only one death for Kayonga's bodyguards but three civilian deaths.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: The FARDC clashed with the ADF since Wednesday, in 3 locations in Beni (points 6, 16 and 25). A FARDC patrol got into a trap during the night, but there are not reported fatalities. The intervention from MONUSCO soldiers prevented the FARDC vehicle from being burned.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: The MONUSCO forces repelled on December 7th an attack by the ADF on one of their bases along the Mbau-Kamango axis in Beni territory. 15 Dead.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 07 December. In Semuliki, North Kivu, which resulted in the killing of 15 peacekeepers from Tanzania. Forty-four peacekeepers were also injured during the attack, attributed to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF). After a lull in their activities, ADF has resumed their attacks in the area, including against civilians.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
SOURCE: Daily News (DRC); The New Humanitarian; UN (unspecified); Deutsche Welle; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi; AFP
NOTES: An attack by suspected ADF fighters on the MONUSCO base in Semliki in Nord Kivu in the evening of 7 December left 14 MONUSCO and 5 FARDC soldiers dead. Another 53 blue helmets were injured during the attack and reports of rebel deaths vary from dozens to 72. The attack was described by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres as a 'war crime' and the worst attack on UN peacekeepers in the organisation's recent history.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: The MONUSCO base which had been attacked on December 7th by the ADF has now been reoccupied.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Around 13 January 2018, the FARDC launched an offensive in Eastern DRC. The offensive took place in the territories of Beni, Oicha and Lubero, and targeted all the armed group involved in conflict in the region, in particular the ADF.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Mambaiko/Mamba Iko, expelling the ADF.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Silimbamba, expelling the ADF.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On January 14th, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Sesele, expelling the ADF.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On Saturday, January 27th, a Pakistani member of MONUSCO was killed during an operation in Lulimba against an armed group. At least another peacekeeper was injured during the attack. Later reports indicate the attackers were Mai Mai.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

NOTES: On 17 March, an armed group attacked a MONUSCO deployment in Gbi, around 14h30.

NOTES: On 17 March, an armed group attacked a Uruguayan MONUSCO deployment in Djo at around 18h. 2 rebels were killed.

NOTES: On April 10, the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, recovered 10 localities, among which Gbi, Joo, Cafe and Nyamamba in Djugu, which are along the riverside of Lake Albert until Tchomia.

NOTES: 14 April. FARDC units got surrounded by ADF in Mayimoya and required MONUSCO attack helicopters for support

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On April 16, the FARDC clashed with the ADF in the region of Garlic, 50km north of the city of Beni. 2 helicopters belonging to MONUSCO supported the FARDC with airstrikes.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 20 April, ADF gunmen killed a motorcycle driver and his client close to Tungudu village in Beni territory. They were on their way to Ndalya market in Ituri. The FARDC chased and attacked the ADF forces right after the attack, killing one ADF.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika); Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
SOURCE: Xinhua; RFI; Daily Monitor (Uganda); AFP; AP
NOTES: On May 11, a MONUSCO convoy was attacked by presumed Mayi Mayi Hapa na pale in Tanganyka province. Two UN members went missing, while the remaining 11 were safe. Another report by Xinhua mentions that 13 UN soldiers were abducted, but that 11 were released. The 2 missing UN soldiers were found on May 16. The Hapa na pale are supported by, or in a coalition with, the Yakutumba and Malaika, and the three groups are part of the CNPSC.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
NOTES: 19 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On May 20, military forces clashed with presumed ADF rebels who had just attacked Mbau northeast of Beni and killed 10 civilians (coded in a separate VAC event). The clash lasted 3h and the FARDC managed in the end to repel the assailants. The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Radio Okapi
NOTES: On June 9, presumed ADF militants launched an incursion in Ngite. They first burned 5 houses and some stalls, before clashing with the FARDC. 2 soldiers killed. 5 people were injured and reportedly one person died from the side effects of the violence (from hypertension due to the loud noises caused by the first explosions of the attack).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On July 6, the ADF attacked the FARDC position in Boikene. The FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, pushed them out of the city. Two peacekeepers injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On the night of July 7, the ADF attacked in Beni. The FARDC counted several deaths and a massive displacement of the population. Reports mention at least 1 FARDC killed, several ADF rebels (unknown coded as 3) and also 2 MONUSCO soldiers.

ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 29 July. ADF fired at MONUSCO in Semuliki provoking an exchange of fire

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 23 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked a FARDC position , supported by MONUSCO, in Mukoko village of Beni territory. Two people were killed.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: 03 September. Two MONUSCO peacekeepers, two soldiers and two civilians were injured during an ADF ambush in the Ngadi area. Two civilians were also abducted but later escaped.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 03 September. An unidentified armed group ambushed a MONUSCO convoy along the Mavivi-Boikene road. Two peacekeepers were injured.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 9 September 2018, alleged ADF rebels raided and took over the area surrounding the MONUSCO camp in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC engaged in a firefight with them, incentivizing the locals to seek refuge in Oicha and other neighbourhoods in the city. No fatalities or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 8 October 2018, MONUSCO reinforcements repelled an attack on Congolese military by suspected ADF fighters in Kasinga (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 09 October. the ADF attacked an FARDC position, with MONUSCO support, at Mayi-Moya village of Oicha territory. The attackers also launched a rocket at a car carrying seven people. Eight people were killed, two people wounded (including 1 peacekeeper) and eight were reported missing.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 20 October 2018, the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, counter-attacked following an earlier ADF raid on the Boikene neighborhood of Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) [coded as separate event]. Two FARDC soldiers and 11 civilians were killed in the clashes.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 24 October. ADF forces attacked the MONUSCO base at Semliki bridge (assumed to be in Beni based on river location and ADF area of activity). Peacekeepers repelled the attackers.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Around 10 November 2018 (between 10 - 11 November), presumed ADF rebels attacked Boikene quarter (Beni, Nord-Kivu), burning down the MONUSCO base. Two people were killed during the clash and many others kidnapped. Belongings such as goats were taken and cars were burned. Locals attempted to chase the attackers with FARDC soldiers but were stopped.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 14 November 2018, in Kididiwe, joint FARDC-MONUSCO troops recaptured a former FARDC camp from ADF militiamen. During the operation, 7 United Nations peacekeepers were killed and 10 wounded, while 2 were still missing in action. FARDC reported that 14  soldiers had been killed, 29 had been wounded and 12 were still missing in action. An estimated 40 to 50 ADF combatants were killed.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 15 November 2018, FARDC and MONUSCO clashed with the ADF in Mayangose zone in Boikene quarter (Beni, Nord-Kivu). 7 peacekeepers (6 Malawians and 1 Tanzanian) and 12 soldiers were killed during the clash.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On the evening of November 16, a UN base 7 km north of the city of Beni was attacked by ADF militiamen.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On November 22, near Kamango town (Oicha, Nord-Kivu), a helicopter from the UN mission was shot by Ugandan Muslim rebel (ADF) fire. There were no reported fatalities.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 23 November 2018, presumed ADF rebels attacked and clashed with MONUSCO troops in Massiani district in Boikene quarter (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killed one civilian and injured one civilian and one MONUSCO soldier, while also looting animals and valuable goods.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (1997-2001)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On November 30, in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Ouest), Armed Forces of the DRC (FARDC) and the UN Mission in the DRC (MONUSCO) engaged in a battle with ADF militants who were planning an attack in the area. FARDC also seized ADF weapons. There were no reported injuries or fatalities.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 10 December 2018, in Semuliki (no coordinates available, along the Mbau-Kamango road), unidentified armed group clashed with MONUSCO, injuring 1 peacekeeper (no further details available).

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 10 December. The ADF attacked a MONUSCO base at PK 41 (no coordinates available). MONUSCO repelled the attack.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 14 December 2018, presumed ADF rebels clashed with MONUSCO after two attempted ambushes between Kaskivi and Mukoko village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), one against a Ministry of Health delegation.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 16 December 2018, in Mungoro (5 km from Mavivi), the ADF attacked civilians. FARDC and MONUSCO forces repelled the attack.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 17 December. The FARDC, with support from MONUSCO, responded to the ADF attack on Mangboko and repelled the attackers.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 7 January, in Mavivi, ADF, killed 11 civilians, including 6 children and injuring 1. MONUSCO intervened. The ADF also abducted civilians during the attack.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: 23 January. The UPLC abducted three members of MONUSCO in Kisalala. Shortly after the abduction, the FARDC freed the abductees.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 08 February. MONUSCO launched an offensive against the ADF in the Mayangose Forest (no coordinates available) in Beni.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 10 February (on or around). An unidentified armed group ambushed MONUSCO and FARDC forces along the Beni-Butembo road.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 17 February. Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked a CENI warehouse and a residence owned by Kabila in Beni (unclear if in Beni town or territory). Police, military, and MONUSCO forces repelled the attackers.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: 07 May 2019. An unidentified armed group, consisting of approximately 100 fighters, attacked Blukwa, Djugu (some sources report the attack occurred in the Lea village). The FARDC contingent in the town was outnumbered and did not engage the attackers. The assailants killed at least two children (some sources report three). They also burned five homes, killed livestock, and pillaged the village. MONUSCO forces intervened and repelled the attackers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
SOURCE: Twitter; Bunia Actualite; Sauti Ya Congo; La Libre Afrique; Actualite
NOTES: On 26 June, in Djugu area, FARDC operation Zaruba ya Ituri was started. The FARDC, with support of MONUSCO attack helicopters, has clashed with Lendu militias under the control of Mathieu Ndudjolo and possibly CODECO members in Wago Forest and killed 16. 5 AK 47, 1 RPG 7 and cold weapons were seized.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
