SOURCE: Bunia Actualite; La Libre Afrique; Radio Okapi; Sauti Ya Congo; AFP; Actualite
NOTES: On 27 June, in Djugu area, FARDC with support of MONUSCO attack helicopters has clashed with Lendu and possibly CODECO combatants, recapturing Wago Forest and killing 18. Additionally 3 FARDC soldiers have been wounded.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: On 28 June, in Djugu area, FARDC ground forces, with air support of MONUSCO attack helicopters, clashed with a Lendu militia in the Wago Forest and killed 10.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 14 September, in Beni area, ISIS-affiliated news agency Nashir made a first claim of suspected ADF ambush of FARDC and MONUSCO troops. The message claims killing and injury of number of soldiers as well as capture of weaponry, specific numbers of fatalities not known, coded as 10

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: La Libre Afrique; AFP; Bunia Actualite; 7 Sur 7
NOTES: On 18 September 2019, in unspecified location in Ituri province, unidentified armed group has been repelled by MONUSCO after killing many civilians in three different attacks.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 27 October 2019, Ugandan ADF rebels reportedly carried out an incursion in the centre of the town of Mbau, 20 km north of Beni in Nord-Kivu, sparking clashes with FARDC supported by MONUSCO forces in the area, with no report of casualties. ADF rebels executed 2 civilians and injured 4 others, looting several shops and houses, before the allegedly late intervention of FARDC. (coded as two separate events).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 6 November 2019, Kibukila Mayi Mayi fighters reportedly attacked the IDP camp of Mikenge village in Itombwe, Sud-Kivu, and injured two IDPs before the joint intervention of FARDC and MONUSCO forces. One Mayi Mayi was reported killed and at least two FARDC soldiers injured. Two separate events are coded.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 12 November 2019, clashes were reported between Ugandan ADF rebels and MONUSCO forces near Semuliki area of Nord-Kivu, at the crossing between the Mbau-Kamango road and the Semliki bridge (coded at Abia). The rebels reportedly fled after a Ukranian Mi-24 helicopter opened fire on their positions.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 14 November 2019, FARDC and police forces, also supported by MONUSCO forces, reportedly thwarted an attack by Ugandan ADF rebels on Oicha's general hospital, Nord-Kivu, for the second consecutive day, with no report of casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 15 November 2019, FARDC and police forces reportedly thwarted an attack of Kiyandenga Mayi Mayis on Mabasele western neighbourhood of Oicha, Nord-Kivu, killing 3 militiamen and injuring others. *Note that this is the third attack on Oicha in as many days, the two previous ones carried out by Ugandan ADF rebels.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 4 December 2019, the dead body of a peacekeeper was found in the area of Beni suspectedly killed by ADF elements.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 7 December 2019, an attack by unidentified armed men took place against MONUSCO facitilities in Biakato, Ituri. No injured nor fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 11 February 2020, ADF clashed with FARDC and MONUSCO in Mbau. No report on fatalities.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 29 March 2020, armed clashes between ADF elements and FARDC forces, assisted by MONUSCO officials, took place in Kisiki (Beni, Nord-Kivu). After the clashes, it was reported 38 hostages were released. Three fatalities were reported, including two civilians and a FARDC soldier.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: As reported on 11 April 2020, MINUSCA elements clashed with CODECO militiamen near Bunia (Ituri) after the former ambushed them. A Moroccan blue helmet was seriously injured and taken to the hospital.

ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 19 April 2020, a battalion of FDLR combatants clashed with the FARDC and Rwandan military forces, in an attempt to retake Kazoroho village, in Tongo groupement (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The clash left 18 FDLR combatants killed and 5 others injured. The latter were taken to the hospital in Kiwanja by MONUSCO military forces. One FDLR high commander was reportedly captured.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 28 April 2020, CODECO militiamen clashed with FARDC soldiers and MONUSCO peacekeepers in Saliboko (Djugu, Ituri), resulting in 9 rebels killed and 3 FARDC soldiers injured. The clashes started after the rebels attacked a MONUSCO convoy that was supporting a FARDC position in the village.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
NOTES: On 17 May 2020, MONUSCO UN peacekeepers with the support of the FARDC exchanged fire with CODECO militiamen in Ndjala village, near Largu (Djugu, Ituri), the day after these rebels killed 21 civilians in a nearby village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 25 May 2020, MONUSCO peacekeepers shot and wounded 1 police officer at a police station in Eringeti locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The motive of the incident is not reported. The wounded officer was transferred to Goma for treatment by MONUSCO.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Biloze Bishambuke)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: MNCTV Congo; Actualite; Twitter; Africa 1; Radio Okapi; 7 Sur 7; AFP; La Prunelle; BBC News
NOTES: On 28 May 2020, Mayi Mayi (Biloze Bishambuke) militiamen clashed with FARDC elements and MONUSCO troops during an incursion against a camp of IDPs protected by the UN in Mikenge (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). The rebels shot and injured between 3 and 8 camp residents who were then rescued by MONUSCO troops. Two rebels and 1 FARDC soldier were killed, and 2 MONUSCO peacekeepers were injured in the crossfire. The state forces managed to drive off the rebels, capturing 1 of them and recovering 89 cows they had looted.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
NOTES: On 3 June 2020, MONUSCO peacekeepers on patrol clashed with CODECO militiamen near Drodro village (Djugu, Ituri) when these rebels attempted to attack the camp for internal displaced people located at this village. The UN forces managed to drive off the assailants. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 21 June 2020, Mayi Mayi militiamen of an unidentified faction clashed with MONUSCO troops on patrol during an attempted incursion into Mayitatu village, 1 Km from Mayimoya village, resulting in 1 rebel and 1 civilian man injured. Reportedly, the blue helmets opened fire when the rebels prevented them from patrolling the area.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 22 June 2020, ADF militiamen clashed with MONUSCO troops on patrol in Makisabo village, a few Km from Kisima (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during an ambush carried out by the rebels which resulted in 1 blue helmet killed and another injured, both from the Indonesian battalion. Some other civilians went missing and more than 1,000 locals fled towards Beni. The assailants also destroyed 4 MONUSCO vehicles.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 23 June 2020, CODECO militiamen clashed with MONUSCO at a UN base in Bayoo and MONUSCO, FARDC, and the police at Gali village, both near Bule village (Djugu, Ituri). The militia combatants were repelled by the state forces with the help of UN armored vehicles. A MONUSCO helicopter overflew the area to deter any potential attack against local civilians. No fatalities and/or injuries reported

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 3 July 2020, the ADF clashed with soldiers of MONUSCO and FARDC in Mukoko in the rural community of Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu) after the group attacked civilians in the road. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 10 July 2020, unidentified militiamen clashed for with the FARDC, police and MONUSCO troops in Jitso (Djugu, Ituri) after the militiamen opened fire on a convoy of civilian vehicles. The state forces drove off the rebels and the convoy continued escorted. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

Overall, at least 20 rebels and 4 FARDC soldiers were killed and 6 soldiers were seriously injured in this village and others during two-day clashes. Fatalities coded across 8 events.

NOTES: On 26 October 2020, the FARDC with the support of the MONUSCO clashed with CODECO's ALC faction for the third day in Zumbe village (Djugu, Ituri). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: La Prunelle; UNSC; Actualite; Twitter; 7 Sur 7; MNCTV Congo; Kivu Security Tracker; La Libre Afrique; BBC News
NOTES: On 28 December 2020, the FARDC, with the support of the MONUSCO, clashed with ADF rebels in Loselose village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during an attack by the rebels against FARDC barracks. 2 FARDC soldiers were killed and 6 others were injured. From the ADF ranks, 5 combatants were killed, and 6 others injured. The FARDC, which had military aerial support, managed to repel the attackers. ISCAP claimed the attack and said they had killed 4 soldiers and injured another. Subsequent reports suggest that, during the incursion, the ADF killed 7 civilians and 12 FARDC soldiers, effectively occupying the area of Loselose which the FARDC forces later regained on 1 January with MONUSCO support.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Twitter; Kivu Security Tracker; Radio Okapi
NOTES: On 26 February 2021, elements of the FARDC, as well as MONUSCO troops, clashed against ADF militiamen on the route of Beni-Kasindi near Makisabo (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The ADF killed 3 civilians during the incursion, before the FARDC and MONUSCO intervened. Subsequent reports suggest that ISCAP claimed the attack.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: La Prunelle; Actualite; Election-Net; Radio Okapi; Al Nabaa; BPF
NOTES: On 9 April 2021, MONUSCO reportedly killed 1 element of the ADF in the village of Kilia (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following a double ADF attack against civilians in Kilia and Makisabo that resulted in 5-7 male civilian casualties, 1 ADF casualty and 1-2 injuries. 6 fatalities coded across two events. The ISCAP reportedly claimed the attack.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO-URDPC: Cooperative for Development of Congo (Union of Revolutionaries for the Defense of the Congolese People)
NOTES: On 14 April 2021, MONUSCO peacekeepers attacked CODECO-URDPC militiamen in the village of Fataki (Djugu, Ituri). Reports suggest that MONUSCO drove off the CODECO-URDPC from the village. In the attack, 8 militiamen were killed, as well as 9 civilians, and livestock was looted. Threats were made on the Catholic Parish in the village.

ACTOR1: CODECO-URDPC: Cooperative for Development of Congo (Union of Revolutionaries for the Defense of the Congolese People)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 16 April 2021, CODECO-URDPC fighters clashed against MONUSCO peacekeepers in the village of Yikpa (Djugu, Ituri). The CODECO-URDPC killed 1 person and set houses on fire. Reports suggest that MONUSCO peacekeepers drove off the militiamen from the village.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO-URDPC: Cooperative for Development of Congo (Union of Revolutionaries for the Defense of the Congolese People)
NOTES: On 17 April 2021, the FARDC clashed against the CODECO-URDPC in Sanduku (Djugu, Ituri), after the armed group attacked a military base in the area. Nepalese peacekeepers from MONUSCO assisted the FARDC in repelling the attackers. No injuries and/or fatalities.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Bira Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
SOURCE: Twitter; Kivu Security Tracker; Bunia Actualite; Radio Okapi; MNCTV Congo
NOTES: On 18 April 2021, the FARDC clashed against the FPIC/Chini ya Kilima (reportedly of the Bira ethnic group) in the villages of Balingina, Nyankunde and Marabo (Irumu, Ituri). 10 people were killed in Marabo (5 Chini ya Kilima-FPIC, 2 FARDC and 3 civilians), where around 30 vehicles were looted and 5 burnt. 10 other civilians were wounded in the clashes. The FARDC, in cooperation with the MONUSCO, pushed out FPIC from the village of Marabo. Community displacements were triggered. 10 fatalities across three events.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Kivu Security Tracker; Actualite; La Prunelle; Radio Okapi
NOTES: Around 20 April 2021, the FARDC clashed against a Mayi Mayi group (faction unknown) at the airfield of Butembo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), located in the Rughenda neighborhood, after the armed group attacked a military and MONUSCO base. Reports suggest that these militiamen were armed with guns and knives. During the clashes, 4 militiamen were killed, including 1 woman.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
NOTES: On 22 April 2021, the FARDC and MONUSCO clashed against the FPIC in the village of Marabo (Ituri, Irumu). 11-17 FPIC militants were killed and 7-9 others were captured. 4 weapons were recovered by the FARDC. Reports suggest that the militants were pushed out of the village.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Around 22 April 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO clashed against a Mayi Mayi group (faction unknown) in the village of Mulo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). Reports suggest that the army repelled the assailants. 1 FARDC soldier was killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
SOURCE: BBC News; Radio Okapi; Bunia Actualite
NOTES: Around 1 May 2021, the FARDC, in cooperation with Bangladeshi elements of the MONUSCO, clashed against the CODECO in the locality of Kasibana/Kasingbana, located near Amee (Djugu, Ituri), following an attempted incursion by the armed group to the community. Reports suggest that the MONUSCO repelled the militiamen, who fled with 23 goats. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); Military Forces of Malawi (2014-)
SOURCE: La Prunelle; Reuters; Kivu Security Tracker; Actualite; BPF; AFP
NOTES: On 10 May 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO clashed against presumed militants of the ADF in the village of Kilya (Beni, Nord-Kivu). 4-6 people were killed in the clashes, including a female MONUSCO soldier (from Malawi), 1 FARDC soldier and 2-6 civilians (some of whom were Nande and one of whom was a motorcycle driver coming from Halungupa). The civilians were reportedly ambushed while carrying a civilian dead body who was killed in Bwerere. The motorcycle was burnt. The body of the driver was found in this location the next day.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Actualite; Kivu Security Tracker; La Libre Afrique; Al Nabaa; AFP; Election-Net; Radio Okapi
NOTES: Around 10 May 2021, the FARDC reportedly killed 8-10 ADF militants in Halungupa (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Other sources by the ISCAP, however, point out that the clash involved another set of actors on the side of the FARDC, including Kenyan and Somalian forces (likely MONUSCO). The ISCAP claimed the event.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 13 May 2021, the ADF reportedly attacked the FARDC, along with reported Ugandan/Kenyan forces (assumed MONUSCO), in the village of Halungupa (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Several soldiers were wounded. The ISCAP claimed the event.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 13 May 2021, the ADF reportedly attacked the FARDC/MONUSCO forces in the village of Kisima (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Militant reports suggest that several soldiers were killed as a result of the clashes, but this was not independently reported. ISCAP claimed the attack.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: On 16 May 2021, the MONUSCO repelled an attack by an unidentified armed group in the village of Lenga (Djugu, Ituri). 1 civilian was injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
SOURCE: Kivu Security Tracker; Twitter; UN (unspecified); AFP; Africa 1; ReliefWeb; La Prunelle; Actualite; Radio Okapi; Bunia Actualite
NOTES: On 31 May 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO clashed against an unidentified armed group in the village of Tshabi (Irumu, Ituri), while the said group killed 23-28 people in the village (including 4 women, 15 men, and 4 children) and kidnapped 10 others. The group also attacked the villages of Boga, Rubingo and Kinyanjojo (coded as other events). Altogether, 48000 were displaced and 27 others were abducted. Some sources speculate that the attack was carried out by the ADF, while others say it may have been an ethnic clash between the Nyali and Banyabwisha.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: 7 Sur 7; Radio Okapi; Actualite; Kivu Security Tracker; Bunia Actualite; Politico (DRC)
NOTES: On 7 June 2021, the FARDC, along with the MONUSCO, clashed against the ADF in the villages of Kinyanjojo and Boga (Irumu, Ituri). Initially, during the attacks, at least 12 people were killed (2 of whom were ADF militants), 3 medical compounds were burnt, several civilians were abducted, 1 FARDC soldier was injured, and one grave was desecrated. 2 AK47 weapons were recovered. On 20 June, at least 23 bodies of civilians, which were reportedly killed on this day, were recovered in Boga and Tshabi (coded as another event). Some sources suggest the attack was carried out by the ADF in coalition with a Hutu-led group, the Banyabwisha. Community displacements were triggered. In total, with the 20 June body discovery, at least 18 fatalities took place.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: 7 Sur 7; Kivu Security Tracker; Radio Okapi; Politico (DRC); Bunia Actualite; Actualite
NOTES: On 7 June 2021, the FARDC, along with the MONUSCO, clashed against the ADF in the villages of Boga and Kinyanjojo (Irumu, Ituri). During the attacks, at least 12 people were killed (2 of whom were ADF militants), 3 medical compounds were burnt, several civilians were abducted, 1 FARDC soldier was injured, and one grave was desecrated. 2 AK47 weapons were recovered. Some sources suggest the attack was carried out by the ADF in coalition with a Hutu-led group, the Banyabwisha. Community displacements were triggered. 12 fatalities coded across two events.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO-URDPC: Cooperative for Development of Congo (Union of Revolutionaries for the Defense of the Congolese People)
SOURCE: Kivu Security Tracker; Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo; UNOCHA; Politico (DRC)
NOTES: On 14 June 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO attacked the CODECO-URDPC in the village of Fataki (Djugu, Ituri). The FARDC/MONUSCO drove the militiamen out of the village. During the clashes on this day, 21 CODECO-URDPC were killed. Overall, some reports suggest that, during the 5-day clash, at least 42 militiamen were killed as well as 2 FARDC soldiers. 8,000 people were displaced as a result of the clashes, the majority of whom sought refuge at the MONUSCO in Djaiba.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 23 June 2021, the CODECO attacked the MONUSCO base in the village of Rho/Roe (Djugu, Ituri). Reports suggest that the CODECO was attempting an attack against civilians who were seeking refuge at the MONUSCO base. The MONUSCO repelled the attackers. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: BBC News; Radio Okapi; HumAngle; AFP; Twitter; Bunia Actualite
NOTES: On 3 July 2021, an unidentified armed group attacked the MONUSCO in the locality of Aveba (Irumu, Ituri) while a group of people prevented a MONUSCO helicopter from landing on their base. The group had gathered in the locality based on rumours that ADF militants were being transported to the area. Gun shots were fired and 1 person was killed. At least four people were injured.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
NOTES: On 11 July 2021, the MONUSCO regained territory in the villages of Kashigbana and Auora, located in the province of Ituri, coded as Bunia (Bunia, Ituri), after disloging and pushing out the CODECO from the area. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Cas-Info; Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo; 7 Sur 7; Election-Net; Radio Okapi; La Prunelle
NOTES: On 8 August 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO regained territory of Haie/Haye I and Haie/Haye II, located in the valley of Mwalika (Beni, Nord-Kivu) after bombarding the ADF militants, resulting in at least 45 fatalities from the ADF side. The army reports this was the training bastion of the ADF. They also attacked other nearby areas, including Lusilubi, Nzelube, Semuliki and Talya rivers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 18 August 2021, the FARDC with the cooperation of the MONUSCO regained the area between the Semuliki and Talya rivers, located in the territory of Beni (Nord-Kivu), following a series of air strikes against the ADF. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO-URDPC: Cooperative for Development of Congo (Union of Revolutionaries for the Defense of the Congolese People)
NOTES: On 20 August 2021, MONUSCO officials attacked CODECO-URDPC members during a raid in Shuber, near Rakpa (Mahagi, Ituri). Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: BBC News; MONUSCO; Reuters; Bunia Actualite; AP; Politico (DRC); Twitter; AFP; BPF; La Libre Afrique; Actualite; Telegram; Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo; Radio Okapi
NOTES: On 1 September 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO clashed against suspected ADF militants after they ambushed a convoy of vehicles traveling with army protection near Ofai (Irumu, Ituri), between Komanda and Luna. Overall, at least 4 were killed (all of whom were men and refugees/IDPs) and 80-100 people were kidnapped. 14-18 vehicles were burnt down and 1 FARDC officer disappeared. The FARDC/MONUSCO eventually released 50-70 of the abducted victims, some of them in Mafifi. Community displacements were triggered. The ISCAP claimed the event, targeting Christians.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: SOS Medias; Kivu Security Tracker; Xinhua; Radio Okapi; AFP; Actualite; La Prunelle; ICRC
NOTES: On 23 September 2021, the FARDC and the MONUSCO reportedly clashed against presumed ADF fighters who attacked the localities of Bogi (Irumu, Ituri), as well as Kipe ya Yo, Vingazi and Komanda town (coded as other events). Overall, at least 5 people were killed, including civilians and 1 rebel, and others kidnapped (including a Red Cross worker). Further, shops of merchants and 33-36 houses were burnt/looted. The group was in possession of automatic rifles and spoke broken Swahili. 5 fatalities spread across three events.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: La Prunelle; Actualite; SOS Medias; Kivu Security Tracker; AFP; ICRC; Radio Okapi
NOTES: On 23 September 2021, the FARDC and the MONUSCO reportedly clashed against presumed ADF fighters who attacked the localities of Kipe ya Yo and Vingazi, located near Komanda town (Irumu, Ituri). The group was also attacked the town and the locality of Bogi (coded as other events). Overall, at least 5 people were killed, civilians and 1 rebel, and others kidnapped (including a Red Cross worker). Further, shops of merchants and 33-36 houses were burnt/looted. The group was in possession of automatic rifles and spoke broken Swahili. 5 fatalities spread across three events.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: ICRC; Actualite; Kivu Security Tracker; La Prunelle; SOS Medias; Xinhua; Radio Okapi; Nashir; BBC News; Telegram; AFP
NOTES: On 23 September 2021, the FARDC and the MONUSCO reportedly clashed against presumed ADF fighters who attacked Komanda town (Irumu, Ituri), as well as other nearby localities (coded as other events). Overall, at least 5 people were killed (including civilians and 1 rebel) and others kidnapped (including a Red Cross worker). Further, shops of merchants and 33-36 houses were burnt/looted. The group was in possession of automatic rifles and spoke broken Swahili. 5 fatalities spread across three events. The ISCAP claimed the event in this location, killing 7 people (4 soldiers and 3 civilians) and burning buildings of Christians with mortar shells.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo; FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
SOURCE: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo; MONUSCO; BBC News; Twitter; Nashir; Bunia Actualite; La Prunelle; Xinhua
NOTES: On 26 September 2021, the FARDC/MONUSCO clashed against presumed ADF/FPIC fighters in Makayanga (Irumu, Ituri), where at least 1-16 members of the group were killed and others detained. Other sources suggest that 12 civilians were also killed during the clashes. The ISCAP claimed the attack, killing several FARDC officers and burning of barracks. 10-40 rebels, including FPIC/FRPI, were detained. The FPIC burnt the house of a journalist.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Kivu Security Tracker; Nashir
NOTES: On 9 October 2021, presumed ADF fighters clashed against the FARDC/MONUSCO around Mambelenga-Kidepo (Irumu, Ituri). The clashes were triggered by an ADF attack on a convoy escorted by the FARDC/MONUSCO. 4-6 cars were reportedly burnt and several people are missing. The ISCAP claimed the event, reporting 6 fatalities. The fatalities could not be independently verified.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 23 November 2021, the MONUSCO clashed against the ADF in the periphery of Tshabi/Tchabi (Irumu, Ituri). The MONUSCO attempted to push out the rebels. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2021-)
NOTES: On 5 December 2021, a MINUSMA patrol was subjected to a complex ambush in the town of Kidal (Kidal, Kidal) by presumed Ansar Dine (JNIM) militants. A MINUSMA vehicle struck an IED and was then subjected to small arms and RPG fire. One peacekeeper sustained injuries inflicted by own firearm.

NOTES: 6 AMISOM troops killed, 12 wounded in 23 Feb fighting in Mogadishu.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy fighting continued in Mogadishu around the ex-Ministry of Defence and in Talex and Shaqalaha areas in Hodan District on 23 and 24/10. AMISOM forces remained in control of the building that had been captured on 23/02 despite at least 3 AS offensives starting at 03.00 in the night of 23-24/02. AMISOM defences in that location have been reinforced throughout the day. Artillery fire from the AMISOM base in Mogadishu airport has been reported for most of the day and has been particularly intense in the night.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM, TFG and allied groups 24 Feb launched coordinated attack in Mogadishu and along Ethiopian, Kenyan border; Ethiopian troops reportedly involved in fighting, Kenya closed border.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)
NOTES: AMISOM and TFG forces continued their offensive against AS positions in these two districts. AMISOM/TFG captured in the morning several key areas such as Florence, Sinai Junction and parts of Aden Adde Road encountering strong resistance. AMISOM/TFG forces abandoned at least some of these positions in the end of the afternoon. Unconfirmed reports establish that 19 people were killed and 29 injured as a result of the fighting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Sporadic clashes opposed AS and AMISOM forces around the ex-Ministry of Defense. AS were not able to retake the positions lost after 23/02.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Exchange of artillery fire between AMISOM and AS-held areas was reported in the morning. One of the rounds reportedly landed in a residential area killing 1 civilian and injuring 6 others.

NOTES: AS launched another attack against TFG/AMISOM positions in the ex-Ministry of Defense on Sunday night . At least 5 civilians were killed and more than 10 others injured.

NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forces were again attacked by AS fighters in Odweyne area, near the former Defense Ministry in Dayniile district. The AS attack was repelled. At least one TFG soldier is believed to have been injured.

NOTES: AS and TFG/AMISOM forces sporadically clashed in Talex neighborhood of Hodan district. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports 5 March indicated at least 50 AMISOM troops killed, some 150 injured during major offensive against militants in Mogadishu in Feb.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A heavy fighting broke out between AMISOM Burundian force based at the Ministry of Defense in Hodan district and AS on Saturday Morning. AMISOM is believed to have repelled the attack. The number of causalities is currently unknown.

NOTES: AS militants attacked TFG/AMISOM troops at the above mentioned area (near Jaale Siyad Military Academy). One civilian was reportedly killed and 7 other were injured. AS forces retreated.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters clashed at the Arwada building area in Talex neighborhood in Hodan district. AS fighters had attacked TFG/AMISOM defense positions in the area but were forced to retreat after an hour of fighting. Two TFG soldiers were injured, but casualties among AS fighters could not be established.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An armed clash between TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters occurred at Siigaale neighborhood in Hodan district. This was after AS fighters fired RPGs and B10 rounds at TFG/AMISOM positions. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Sporadic armed clashes and exchange of artillery fire between TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters were reported at Dabka area in Hodan district. AS fighters fired RPGs and B10 rounds at TFG/AMISOM positions but were repulsed. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers engaged AS in heavy clashes at Siigaale and Dabka junction areas of Hodan district. This was after AS fighters fired several B10 rounds and RPGs against the aforementioned TFG/AMISOM positions but were repulsed. Initial reports indicate that two AS fighters, one TFG soldier and two others were reportedly killed while three TFG soldiers and four others were injured.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS forces launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG forces at around 05.30. Clashes lasted for around 15 minutes. A TFG spokesman in the area declared that several AS militants had been killed and 5 had been captured.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militants launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG forces based in the above mentioned area. The clash lasted for around 20 minutes and was accompanied with artillery fire. Local medias reported the death of 5 persons and the injury of more than 8 others, most of them combatants.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy clashes and shelling exchanges between TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters were reported to have occurred simultaneously at the Juba, post and telecommunication ministry building and old seaport areas. This was shortly after AS fighters had launched an attack against the TFG/AMISOM positions. Initial reports indicate that six TFG soldiers were killed and two others injured. Casualties from AS fighters could not be established. The AS militants were repulsed after one-and-a-half hours fighting.

NOTES: Armed clashes and shelling between TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS were reported at Talex neighborhood in Hodan district after AS fighters attacked TFG/AMISOM positions. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militants launched a large scale attack against several TFG and AMISOM positions at around 22.00 on 16/03/2011. The clashes lasted more than 3 hours in some locations. Sheikh Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab, and AS Spokesman, declared to local medias after the attack that AS had captured several positions and killed a large number of TFG/AMISOM soldiers. This report was contradicted by the TFG Vice-Commander Gen. Abdikarim Dheba-Badan who denied that AS attacks had achieved any significant result. More than 10 civilians are reported to have been killed and 29 injured. The AS attack was said to have been led by Abdulkadir Commandos, former HI senior commander.

NOTES: AS militants launched an attack against TFG and AMISOM forces based in the above mentioned areas around midnight. Shooting and artillery fire ensued. 3 civilians were reportedly killed while 5 others injured.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militants launched a hit-and-run attack against TFG/AMISOM forces based in the above mentioned areas. The confrontation lasted only a few minutes and resulted in the killing of one civilian and the injury of 5 others.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG forces in the above mentioned area and retreated after 1 hour of fighting. No civilian casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Armed clash and mortar shelling between TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters occurred at the frontline positions of Milk Factory, African village and near Shaqalaha (AU Base) in Hodan District. One person was reportedly killed while two TFG soldiers and four civilians were injured. Casualties on AS side could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG force based in the above mentioned areas. One civilian was killed and 7 others were injured.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM and TFG forces fired several rounds against AS bases in the above mentioned areas. As a result of the incident one employee of the Somali University was killed while 9 civilians were injured including one guard from the Somali University.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG forces together with AMISOM launched early in the morning an offensive against AS bases along the existing demarcation line in central Mogadishu. The attack was followed by heavy fighting and artillery fire. 10 persons were reported killed and 20 others injured according to ambulance sources. TFG military deputy Commander Gen. Abdikarim Yusuf Aden a.k.a Dheba-Badan told the reporters that a high number of AS militants had been killed and showed the dead bodies of two young men. He added that AS had been expelled from several positions. The AS Operations Spokesman on his side, Sheikh Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab, told medias that the AMISOM offensive had failed and that the AS themselves had captured several bases from what he called non-believers. At the time of the writing of this report it is not possible to confirm if AMISOM/TFG forces had remained in control of the positions they had gained in the morning.

NOTES: AS forces launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG positions in the evening and the following day early in the morning. The attack involved an exchange of artillery fire. 3 civilians were reportedly killed and 6 other injured.

NOTES: In an attempt to recapture positions lost in the morning AS forces launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG forces in the above mentioned areas. ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/TFG forces launched a large scale attack against AS positions in the above mentioned districts. AS Operations Spokesman Sheikh Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab claimed and declared that AS had destroyed 1 technical and 1 truck belonging to AMISOM/TFG forces. TFG Banadir Region Spokesman Mohamed Abdullahi Arig on his side also claimed victory and asserted that AMISOM/TFG forces had captured new positions. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 3 AMISOM soldiers, 11 AS fighters and 4 TFG soldiers were killed in the fighting.

NOTES: Heavy clashes and shelling erupted after AS launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG positions in the above mentioned areas. AS forces retreated after an hour of fighting.

NOTES: Heavy clashes and shelling erupted after AS launched an attack against AMISOM/TFG positions in the above mentioned areas. AS forces retreated after an hour of fighting.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters clashed at Siigaale neighborhood after AS launched an attack against TFG/AMISOM positions. The AS were forced to retreat after 40 minutes of fighting. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers clashed heavily with AS fighters at Dhagaxtur School near Dabka junction and Siigaale area near Shaqalaha building. Initial report indicates that one TFG soldier was killed and two others injured. Casualties from AS could not be established. AS fighters were repulsed after half an hour of fighting.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS forces launched an attack against TFG/AMISOM positions in the Milk Factory area, resulting in heavy clashes. Unconfirmed reports indicate that a stray mortar round landed in Black Sea neighborhood in Hodan district, killing one person and injuring six others. AS fighters were repulsed after an hour of fighting. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters clashed at Shaqalaha area after AS fighters launched an attack against TFG/AMISOM positions. Two AS fighters and another person were reportedly killed and three others injured. The AS were forced to retreat.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers and AS fighters clashed at Shaqalaha, Dabka areas in Hodan district and Bermuda neighborhood near Sayidka in Howl-Wadag district. AS carried out the attack and fired several B10 and RPG rounds against TFG/AMISOM positions. AS fighters were repulsed after two hours of fighting. ACTOR1: Al Shabaab

NOTES: AS attacked TFG/AMISOM positions captured in the last weeks offensive. Fighting started in the morning hours by sporadic shooting and shelling and intensified in the evening after AS reinforced its positions in the contested areas. Most of the mortars fired by TFG/AMISOM were reported to have been targeting Bakara Market. At least 5 civilians died as a result of the fighting inside Bakara Market and 2 others at Dayniile Hospital where they got transported after sustaining injuries in the area. At least 30 other civilians were injured inside Bakara Market.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab

NOTES: TFG and AMISOM forces launched a new offensive aiming at capturing Kidka Wadnaha Road. Heavy clashes and mortar exchange were reported from 07.00 to mid morning. By 09.45 TFG/AMISOM forces had captured Howl-Wadag Junction and had entered in parts of Bakara Market (Hormuud Telecommunications main building, Telecom office building, Dahaabshiil main office). TFG/AMISOM forces were then ordered to return back along Kidka Wadnaha Road. Sources estimate the number of killed and wounded between 16-20 and 24-45 respectively. Sporadic fighting continued in the area until the evening

Reports indicate that TFG/AMISOM soldiers seized 2 RPGS, 1 PKM machine gun and 6 RCIEDS from AS.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS attacked TFG/AMISOM positions in Boondheere district at about 02:00. Around 05:30 TFG/AMISOM launched a counter attack and took control of former Interior Minister building, Italian & Syrian Embassy, Manopolyo road junction, former Somaliweyn Radio building, Tabeelaha Jaelka, Boondheere District Head Quarters, Police Station and former Royal Hotel in Boondheere district. At least 10 people (fighters included) were killed and 20 others were injured. Following the clashes AS Operations Spokesman Sheikh Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab claimed that AS destroyed 2 AMISOM tanks and a bulldozer and forced another tank to get trapped in a trench. AMISOM acting spokesman Captain Barosber Hakasimi denied the AS claims and stated that TFG/AMISOM gained control over the entire Boondheere district. Evidence provided by AS proves the destruction of a bulldozer and a trapped tank but none of the published photos features either of the supposedly destroyed tank.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The TFG/AMSIOM forces launched an offensive against the AS in Kaaraan district and captured Keysaney Hospital, Halima Hiti, Mowlaa Sheikh Ali Abdulle and Gubadley locations, without encountering major resistance. According to the TFG DC of Kaaraan Abdullahi Mohamed Roble, four AS fighters, three civilians and one TFG soldier were killed in the operation. The AS operations spokesman Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab commented on the offensive and said that the AS repulsed the TFG AMISOM attack and damaged an unspecified number of AMSIOM vehicles.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Following their successful operation in Karaan District on 08/10 AMISOM forces backed by TFG forces launched a new offensive against AS positions in Heliwa and Yaaqshiid District on 09/10. Fighting was more intense than the day before due to a stronger resistance of the AS militias. Several key positions were taken over by AMISOM including the ex-Pasta Factory, Elmiska, ex-Control Balcad, the former Italian Cemetery (Salahu-din training camp), the SOS hospital and the animal market. AMISOM forces now control all Industrial and Balcad roads. Only some urban areas on the fringe of the districts are currently still being held by the AS. During the fighting the SOS Hospital was hit by two artillery rounds and one SOS employee, working close to the hospitals pharmacy, was killed. The INGO issued a communique later stating that for the first time since 1985 it had to completely evacuate its staffs from the area and suspend all its operations. No further clashes were reported on 11/10. Ten AS fighters, four TFG soldiers, two AMISOM soldiers and five civilians were reported killed. 20 other persons, mostly combatants, were reported injured.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two different explosions were reported in Heliwa District after AS vacated the area. Both seem to have been caused by booby-traps/IEDs attached to an abandoned PKM machine-gun and to a Toyata Carib vehicle left near the ex-Pasta Factory. The explosions occurred after TFG soldiers attempted to take the gun and the vehicle. It is the first time such tactics have been reported. Casualties could not be established. At least one workshop for the production of IEDs was discovered during a search operation conducted by TFG forces. Two suspected AS fighters were arrested at the site and handed over to the NSA.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab 20 Oct claimed to have killed over 70 AU troops.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy clashes between TFG/AMISOM forces and AS fighters took place in different locations of Dayniile District throughout the whole day and night until the morning of 22/10. AS militants succeeded in seizing one technical truck equipped with anti-aircraft ZSU-23 from the TFG forces.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy clashes between TFG/AMISOM forces and AS fighters took place in different locations of Dayniile District throughout the whole day and night until the morning of 22/10. AS militants succeeded in seizing one technical truck equipped with anti-aircraft ZSU-23 from the TFG forces. The vehicle was later displayed in Ceelasha.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militias conducted a complex attack against the TFG/AMISOM base in Hero Jarmal compound. Two suicide bombers on foot, dressed in 'TFG uniforms' entered the compound while TFG forces were formed in ranks listening to speeches from TFG and AMSIOM officials. The suicide bombers remained undetected and managed to blow themselves up in close proximity to the TFG forces. Immediately after the PBIED attack a group of AS fighters, possibly also dressed in 'TFG uniforms', utilized the chaos created by the PBIED attacks and attacked the compound firing indiscriminately at TFG and AMISOM forces. Shooting could be heard from the compound and its surrounding for the next several hours. The fighting was closely followed by statements from both sides reporting conflicting numbers of casualties. An AS press statement claimed that 80 AMISOM soldiers were killed, while an AMISOM statement admitted three injuries. Although the exact number of casualties could not be independently verified available information suggests that some 18 AMISOM soldiers and around 22 TFG soldiers may have been killed. The largest number of casualties on the TFG side is believed to have been sustained by troops loyal to General Indha-Adde of the Ayr clan of Hawiye/Habr Gedir. A pro-AS website released an audio-recording from one of the suspected suicide bombers believed to have been an American citizen of Somali origin.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM soldiers clashed with AS fighters who had fired RPGs at their position at the Xoosh Junction area. The AS fighters were pushed back after 15 minutes of fighting. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters launched a well organized and coordinated attack against TFG/AMISOM positions at Ex-control Balad and SOS Hospital area in Heliwa district and Tiida and German Polytechnic Institute of Deynile district. No change of territorial control resulted from the clashes. The TFG DC of Heliwa told the local media that the TFG forces killed four AS militiamen in the fighting.

NOTES: Local medias reported that a TFG soldier had killed an AMISOM soldier from the Ugandan contingent in the afternoon of 14/01. ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militias launched a hit-and-run attack against TFG/AMISOM forces based in Dayniile District in the night of 17-18/01. The fighting lasted for around two hours. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM and TFG forces launched a large-scale offensive against the remaining AS positions in Heliwa and Dayniile districts in the early hours of 20/01. The offensive had in fact started the night before with an intense artillery preparation targeting AS bases in these two districts. AMISOM/TFG forces were reported to have taken control of the remaining urban areas of Heliwa District that were still under AS influence (Livestock Market, Maslah area, up to Darmooley village (5km NE of ex-Control Balcad, on the main road to Balcad/Jowhar). AMISOM/TFG forces also managed to quickly take control of the Mogadishu University building and Baraakat cemetery to the north of Yaaqshiid District (3,5km N of Industrial Road), an area known to host an important AS camp and training facility. The situation in the center of Dayniile District remained however relatively confused. No activity had been reported in the area throughout most of the day of 20/01 but later in the evening AMISOM/TFG forces seemed to have launched an attack from their bases in Tiida and along Industrial Road towards the northern section of the district (airport, hospital). AMISOM forces were reported to have passed AS positions around these two locations and reached the general area of Ali Madhis farm, around 8,5km NW of the Dayniile Hospital and 5,5km SE of the Shabelle River. As of Sunday 22/01 afternoon AMISOM forces had still not fully dislodged AS militias from the center of the Dayniile District. AS militias were reported to have offered little resistance in Heliwa District and around the Mogadishu University. Casualties could not be confirmed.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militias from Lower Shabelle launched a relatively large attack against Jazira village, around 13km SE of the Mogadishu Airport along the seashore in the morning of 31/01. TFG forces based in the village were routed and AS militias took control of the location for around two hours. Medina District militias and TFG/AMISOM forces were sent in reinforcement to expel the AS militias and retook control of the village by the beginning of the afternoon. 10 combatants from the two sides were reportedly killed and more than 10 others wounded. No civilian casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces launched an offensive against AS positions to the west and south-west of Mogadishu in the morning of 14/02. The operation was aimed at increasing the AMISOM/TFG buffer zone between Mogadishu (K7 and Dharkeynley District) and the first AS bases in K13 and Ceelasha along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road. AMISOM forces were reported to have taken Maslah Building along the Afgooye Road around K10 and Ali Janaale Hill to the south-west of Dharkeynley District. The main road from Afgooye to Mogadishu was closed by AMISOM in the morning and reopened by the end of the afternoon of 14/02. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 10 persons including three civilians had been killed and 15 others (mostly fighters) had been injured.

NOTES: AS fighters launched an attack against an AMISOM (Burundi) detachment in Carbiska area near Lafoole Village along the Afgooye Corridor in the evening of 17/08.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Pro-TFG and AMISOM (KDF) forces clashed with AS militias in Garas Dullan village in Baardheere District on 19/08.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Pro-TFG/AMISOM (KDF) forces clashed with AS militias in Ceel-Cadde village 50km SW of Garbaharey on 23/08. The two sides reportedly engaged in a heavy fighting in which artillery guns were used. Another AS unit reportedly destroyed a KDF armoured vehicle after ambushing a KDF convoy rushing to support their colleagues in the village. One civilian was killed and a number of houses were destroyed. Unconfirmed report indicates that 30 combatants were killed during the fighting.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Fierce fighting involving Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia], and Somali government forces against Al-Shabab, began this morning on the outskirts of Hosingow District, which is approximately 150 km from Kismaayo town [southern Somalia].

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AMISOM and TFG forces launched an offensive towards Marka along the Afgooye-K50-Shalaambood road in the evening of 26/08. AMISOM/TFG forces were reported to have reached Shalaambood by the end of the morning of 27/08, after a short confrontation with AS forces in Buufow Bacaad, around 9km NE of that town.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Troops of the African Union Misson in Somalia (AMISOM) who are battling in Somalia on Wednesday killed 42 Al Shabaab militants

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: The town of Miido was retaken during between AMISOM troops and Al Shabaab force resulting in the deaths of at least 36 rebel fighters, 4 KDF soldiers, and 2 Government troop deaths. The four soldiers from this battle, 2 KDF and two transitional troops were subsequently taken to Kismayo by Al Shabaab to be dragged behind a car.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attempted to prevent AMISOM troops from entering Kismayo. 40 were killed in the battle as the African Union forces marched into the city.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two MiG warplanes launched missiles during intermitten fighting between AMISOM troops and Al Shabaab fighters

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Raas Kambooni officials say that they are on the border of Birta Dheer which is 60km from Kismaayo city and that they have taken control of Miido, Harboole and other districts.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Security forces in Somalias southern region of Lower Shabelle began massive security operations in the port city of Merca,100 Km south of Mogadishu, to wash out the insecurity acts by armed groups, reports said.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan planes as part of a sustained AMISOM strategy have continued attacking the city for the second straight day casualties still unknown

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Meanwhile, Somali and Kenya continue to step up attacks against Al Shabaab-controlled port town of Kismayo, where for the fourth-day is under sea, air and ground strikes,

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Meanwhile, Somali and Kenya continue to step up attacks against Al Shabaab-controlled port town of Kismayo, where for the fourth-day is under sea, air and ground strikes,

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Heavily armed Al shabab fighters attacked on Thursday night the town of Badade under the control of Kenyan forces, serving with the AMISOM and the Somalias Transitional Federal Government soldiers.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: More than 100 al Shabaab fighters were killed at the weekend during their attempt to attack Miido town near Kismayu. Multiple sources revealed that more than 250 al Shabaab fighters attacked positions taken by Amisom and Somalia National Army troops in an attempt to dislodge them.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: More than 100 al Shabaab fighters were killed at the weekend during their attempt to attack Miido town near Kismayu. Multiple sources revealed that more than 250 al Shabaab fighters attacked positions taken by Amisom and Somalia National Army troops in an attempt to dislodge them.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Over 50 Al Shabaab militants were killed on Tuesday in one of the insurgents remaining strongholds as the Africa Union peacekeeping forces march towards the strategic port city of Kismayu.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least four TFG soldiers were killed and dozens of others injured as TFG and AMISOM troops clased against Al Shabaab fighters. Military spokesman, Muhammad Dahir Farah told the media that they have also inflicted severe casualties on Al Shabaab (unknown number) and seized several bases from the Islamist group.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A statement by Amisoms [African Union Mission in Somalia] main base in Mogadishu has said they [African Union troops] have captured Xarboole in Lower Jubba Region [southern Somalia].

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: At least 10 people were killed in fierce fighting in the west of the southern Somali port city of Kismaayo, the privately-owned Garowe Online website reported on 15 September. The fighting between Somali forces backed by AU troops and Al-Shabab lead to the 'capture of Bibi, a town that links Afmadow and Qooqani' in Lower Jubba Region, added the website.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The town of Birta Dheer and Biibi were home to heavy clashes on Saturday and Friday as Al Shabaab and Somali alongside AMISOM forces battled furiously.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Allied forces have claimed victory in a battle lasting 3 days in which over 50 people were killed as the allied forces continue their assault on Al Shabaab, Garowe Online reports.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: heavy fighting has broken out in 'Miido town on the outskirts of Kismaayo city in which Al-Shabab claim to have downed a Kenyan army helicopter'

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Allied forces in Jubba Regions [southern Somalia] have opened a new battle front in the town of Jilib in Middle Jubba.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: According to the website, ongoing battles in other locations within Biibi and Harboole districts began after Kenyan and Somali government forces launched attacks on Al-Shabab fighters as Kenyan warplanes shell Al-Shabab positions.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: According to the website, ongoing battles in other locations within Biibi and Harboole districts began after Kenyan and Somali government forces launched attacks on Al-Shabab fighters as Kenyan warplanes shell Al-Shabab positions.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least 50 Al Shabaab militants were killed in yet another deadly attack at Jana Cabdalla, a town 40 kilometers from the port of Kismayu. Military Spokesman Col Cyrus Oguna said the town is now under full control of AMISOM troops who will pacify it en route to Kismayu which is the main target.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least 50 Al Shabaab militants were killed in yet another deadly attack at Jana Cabdalla, a town 40 kilometers from the port of Kismayu. Military Spokesman Col Cyrus Oguna said the town is now under full control of AMISOM troops who will pacify it en route to Kismayu which is the main target.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM and the Somalia National Army troops have taken another al Shabaab stronghold in Sooyac and laid siege to Jana Cabdalla town on their march to the insurgents Kismayu port stronghold. Military sources confirmed that KDF and the SNA allies had been battling the al Shabaab until yesterday to take over control of Jana Cabdalla, about 40m kilometres from Kismayu.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) jets finally hit the militant Al Shabaab stronghold of Kismayu in Somalia on Tuesday, destroying a warehouse and the armoury at the main airport.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Somalias Islamist group Al-Shabab says it has killed 'dozens' of enemy fighters in the southern port city of Kismaayo... 'Mujahidin forces ambush #KDF troops in Canjeel, 30km W[est] of #Kismaayo. Three vehicles destroyed and dozens of invaders killed in a two-hour battle', the group announced on 29 September via its @HSMPress Twitter account.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The Kenyan Contingent of AMISOM is witnessed advancing through an area known as Saamoja, 7km outside of Kismayu. It is unclear if there was a battle, or if rebel fighters retreated without a fight.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces capture a small towns airfield 90km northwest of Mogadishu. It is unclear if there is a fight, or if the field was abandoned.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Four killed and several others injured with government forces and AMISOM clash with al-Shabaab on the outskirts of Kismayo known as Fanoole. The battle took place during the overnight hours.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Shabaab claims an attack on AMISOM forces outside Mogadishu, however, AMISOM commanders dispute the event ever happened.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Heavy fighting involving Somali and Kenyan forces against Al-Shabab fighters in the morning occurred at Kolbiyow locality in Lower Jubba Region. Reports say the clash erupted after Al-Shabab fighters attacked Somali and Kenyan army base on the outskirts of Kulbiyow. Five reported dead, 10 injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: 25 al-Shabaab fighters are killed in the outskirts of Baidoa, in an area known as Goof Gaduud, after a firefight between they, AMISOM, and Somali forces.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab fighters attack a AMISOM military base housed at a local airport over the span of two hours. At least five killed in the fighting, plus injuries.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a series of hit-and-run attacks against Somali forces and its allies. The fighting lasted about one hour, casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces overtake the town of Leego from Shabaab control.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces overtake a Shabaab held town in lower Juba. Ten militants killed in regional fighting. The fighting began when AMISOM forces attacked al Shabaab bases.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab claims to have burnt a tank and killed three Ugandan and seven Somali soldiers. This claim was not substantiated. Locations, dates and other details not provided.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A al Shabaab spokesman claims his group killed 27 AMISOM soldiers along a rural road connecting Mogadishu and Baidoa. The claim has not been substantiated by AMISOM.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy battle following a Shabaab attack on AMISOM forces at a local airport. Two combat vehicles, one tank and one pickup truck were destroyed in the battle, as well as four deaths per side and many other injuries.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Shabaab fighter attacked AU and government positions near the former Presidential Palace building. Causalities unknown. The attack comes on the heels of a Shabaab withdraw from the city.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A Kenyan soldier fighting under AMISOM is shot and killed during a shootout with al Shabaab. It was later learned five Shabaab members were killed in the clash.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Ugandan forces under AMISOM raid a Shabaab hideout, seize weapons. There were no injuries in the operation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Shabaab fighters, or AMISOM forces fire on a civilian over-the-road bus and kill ten people. Apparently the bus drove into a battle occurring between Shabaab and AMISOM forces in the region and were caught in the crossfire.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops have said they killed five Al-Shabab militants after conducting operations along the way that connects Kismaayo port town and Buula Haaji locality in Lower Jubba Region.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Heavy fighting following an ambush between Kenyan/AMISOM forces and al Shabaab results in at least five deaths. The fighting took place in a rural area of Lower Juba. The allied forces were en route to Afmadow city as the ambush attack happened along road which links Kismayo to that city

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces clash with Shabaab militants on the outskirts of Mogadishu. Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it destroyed an Amisom army truck. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab carried out a large operation against AMISOM and government forces in several districts of Mogadishu. This information is from a al-Shabaab propaganda website and allied forces have not confirmed the attacks.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab carried out a large operation against AMISOM and government forces in several districts of Mogadishu. This information is from a al-Shabaab propaganda website and allied forces have not confirmed the attacks.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab carried out a large operation against AMISOM and government forces in several districts of Mogadishu. This information is from a al-Shabaab propaganda website and allied forces have not confirmed the attacks. There were causalities among soldiers in the Dharkeynley District, numbers unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
NOTES: AMISOM and its allies clash with al Shabaab forces 20 km north of Xuddur.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
NOTES: AMISOM security forces and allies clash with al Shabaab forces in a location known as Buuja Calan in or near Baardheere. Four deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG/AMISOM military positions in Jannaale settlement (North of Afgoye Corridor) on 03/11. The clash lasted for 20minutes. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Fighting between Somali/AMISOM forces and AS fighters took place on the road between Km50 and Shalaambood on 05/11. The fighting started after AS fighters ambushed a AMISOM convoy travelling towards Afgooye. Fighting lasted around 40 minutes, causing AMISOM and Somali forces to retreat.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Shabaab militias ambushed an AMISOM military convoy near Buufow Bacaad village in Marka District in the afternoon of 07/11. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire briefly. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG/AMISOM forces based in Lafoole area in Afgooye District in the evening of 08/11. The two sides reportedly engaged in a heavy fighting that lasted for about two hours. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM and Somali forces on the Mogadishu-Baidoa road between Wanla-Weyne and Buur Hakaba in the afternoon of 08/11. The clash lasted for more than one hour. A total of 10 combatants were reportedly killed and 20 others injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Suspected Shabaab forces attack AMISOM/Somali positions. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces launch a series of night time hit-and-run attacks near Xawa Cabdi. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG/AMISOM forces based in Carbiiska area in Afgooye District in the evening of 12/11. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 20 minutes after which AS fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNG convoy in Lafoole area (Afgooye District) in the evening of 14/11. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM military convoy in Garsala village (9km E of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 14/11. The convoy had left Baidoa and was heading to Daynuunay (18km SE of Baidoa) at the time of the ambush. One AMISOM soldier was reportedly killed and three others were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
