Al Shabaab briefly took control of an area of the city, but it was wrestled back with the aid of AMISOM forces. Numbers of casualties vary upon the source - some as high as 35.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: AMISOM-Djibouti contingent clashed with Gaaljecel militia in Beletweyne. One AMISOM soldier killed, three civilian injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launch an attack against anti-al Shabaab militia in Aabacow village, near K50. Al Shabaab briefly overtook the village. Soon after SNAF and AMISOM reinforcements again overtook the village. Two al Shabaab dead in the counter attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: More than 140 al Shabaab fighters were killed by KDF soldiers during a botched attack in Somalias Afmadhow area in Lower Jubba. The gun battle lasted for three hours.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambushed coalition forces at Tijeeg Buul. Two al Shabaab reported dead, following an exchange of gunfire.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNAF and AMISOM forces launched an attack on al Shabaab forces in Halamba village, near K50. One al Shabaab combatant was killed in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Armed clash begun in the west side of Beled Weyne town between AMISOM/Djibouti forces and Galjecel clan militia on 23/10. The fighting was triggered after AMISOM troops tried to expand their defence line into a civilian area that contained business premises and residential blocks, which angered the local people. So far, one AMISOM soldier was killed and another wounded, while two militiamen were wounded also in the clash.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AS fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy withdrawing from Halgan in Nur Fanax (42km S of Beled Weyne) on 24/10. The convoy was heading to Beled Weyne. Number of casualties are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Heavy fighting broke out between AS and Ethiopian forces in the outskirt of Wabxo town on 24/10. The battle begun when AS fighters ambushed an Ethiopian convoy heading to Ceel Buur. This convoy is said to be composed by the ENDF contingent that previously vacated Moqokori and moved to Maxaas.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM Djibouti base in Belet Weyne, beginning with a large explosion from a suicide blast, then with gunfire. At least 10 fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters medevacked injured ENDF forces from Ceel Buur to the Level II AMISOM Hospital in Beled Weyne on 26/10. It is not clear if the soldiers were wounded during a clash among themselves (ENDF personnel in the area have had a history of internal disputes), or if they are the victims from the AS ambush of their convoy in Wabxo. According to unconfirmed reports, an Oromo commander was killed and several other soldiers injured during clashes.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Amhara Ethnic Group (Ethiopia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Fighting broke out between ENDF military groups in Baardheere town in the morning of 27/10. Casualties cannot confirmed. One of the groups is reported to be hailing of Amhara ethnic group of Ethiopia. The motive behind the fighting is reported to have links with the recent political unrest in Ethiopia. For more on Ethiopian withdrawals from Somalia.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy fighting between al Shabaab and AMISOM forces at K50. Causalities on both sides, numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS ambushed an AMISOM convoy travelling from Shalambood to Bulo Mareer town at Golweyn village (24km SW of Marka) on the main road to Baraawe in the morning of 16/10. The ambush was followed by an armed clash in the village between AS fighters and AMISOM. An old woman and a 8-years old girl were killed in the crossfire. The clash has also led the population to flee.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An African Union military vehicle has been destroyed when al-Shabaab fighters ambushed an army convoy in the outskirts of southern town of Buula Mareer. Heavy fighting ensued after the ambush which killed a number of Ugandan soldiers, who are part of African Union peacekeeping mission.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attack and overtake Goof Guduud from joint SNG and AMISOM forces. Seven Somali soldiers reported dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Somali forces recapture Goof Guduud from al Shabaab, hours after they have first gained control of the town. Eight al Shabaab dead, four Somali/AMISOM dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy as ambushed by al Shabaab between Miirtuugo and Ceel Baraf settlements. The AMISOM convoy was damaged; the soldiers returned gunfire and the attackers were overpowered. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNAF forces are attacked in Janaale by al Shabaab. There was an exchange of gunfire. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched an ambush on AMISOM military camps in K50 on the evening on 02/11. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters launched an attack against Halane AMISOM base in Qoryooley on 03/11. Both sides engaged in heavy fighting before attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: An AMISOM (Burundian) supply convoy was targeted with a RCIED which damaged a military vehicle and wounded at least one soldier in Qurac Madoobe (23km NE of Jowhar). The explosion was followed by the exchange of small arms fire by both sides before attackers withdrew. The AMISOM convoy was driving from Ceel Baraf to Mahaday.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNG forces together with AMISOM forces in Qoryooley town reached camp 2 village for patrolling activities (5km NW of Qoryooley) in the morning of 06/11. The joint forces were ambushed by AS fighters on their way, leading to a fight that lasted for an hour before the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AMISOM-Ethiopia forces clash with al Shabaab at Dac. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM-Burundi forces in Ceel Baraf causing 'massive' causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AS fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy traveling from Mogadishu to Baidoa in the morning of 12/11 at Mooda Mooda village (25km NE of Baidoa). Both sides exchanged automatic gunfire, resulting in one ENDF military vehicle burned. After the incident telecommunications were switched off, until the convoy reached its final destination.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked a JSF/AMISOM base located at Hoosingo. Following 30 minutes of small arms fire, al Shabaab retreated. No reports of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Troops from the AMISOM, along with Somali forces have killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters and captured a town in Baraawe District. As al Shabaab forces fled they shot and killed two civilians in retaliation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM position at K60 settlement, near Afgooye. An exchange of gunfire lasted an hour. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AS fighters launched an attack on the AMISOM and SNGF base at KM60 (26km NE of Marka) in the night of 16/11. The AS fighters encountered a defensive response from the joint forces. There is possibility of casualties from both sides, but no clear reports have been received so far.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Six al Shabaab dead after a clash with AMISOM forces in Bulo-Gadud area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A joint force consisting of Jubaland, AMISOM/ENDF and US soldiers, conducting a security operation supposedly to facilitate the ongoing elections in Kismaayo, were targeted with an RCIED at the outskirts of Buur koy (Wirkoy) village (19km SW of Jamaame) on the morning of 18/11. The bomb ripped apart an AMISOM/ENDF military truck and led to the death of four soldiers and the injury of three others, residents report. An intense armed clash pitting the joint forces against the AS fighters ensued. Residents reported the death of 6 AS fighters. The joint forces took control of the village and reportedly recovered AS owned weapons including IED making materials.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Somalia)
NOTES: AS fighters launched an attack against AMISOM and Pro-SNG militia bases in No.50 (Airstrip) (21km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 21/11. Both sides engaged in a thirty minute battle, in which both light and heavy weapons were used, before the AS fighters withdrew. AS claimed that they killed 2 of the AMISOM/Pro-SNG militia but the exact number of casualties remains unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy travelling on the Marka-Baraawe road at Golweyn village (24km SW of Marka) and reportedly killed a number of AMISOM soldiers and badly damaged one of the convoy's vehicles, in the afternoon of 24/11. The AMISOM forces responded with gunfire and reportedly killed 'several' AS fighters. The convoy was returning from Bulo Mareer town to its base at Shalambood village.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An IED attack was targeted against AMISOM convoy on the industrial road near Caafi Factory (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 25/11. The device which was planted on the road damaged one of the AMISOM vehicles, prompting retaliatory gunfire by the AMISOM forces. One civilian reported dead. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two al Shabaab dead following a clash with suspected AMISOM forces in Jowhar.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Two AMISOM/SNG forces are dead following a clash with al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: LSPG: Lower Shabelle People's Guard
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The Lower Shabelle People's Guard (LSPG), a group of clan fighters opposed to AS, together with AMISOM forces attacked AS fighters in Bariire village (23km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 03/12. The joint forces engaged AS in a gunfire that lasted for three hours before AS fighters retreated. Two LSPG fighters and an AMISOM soldier were wounded in the clash while casualties from AS remain unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) said AU and Somali forces have killed at least seven al Shabaab members during a confrontation in Bariirre 04/12.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AS fighters ambushed an AMISOM/KDF convoy heading from Afmadow to Dhobley at Hawina grazing area (94km SW of Afmadow). The ambush which reportedly started with an IED explosion damaged one of the convoy's trucks. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the AS fighters withdrew. The resulting casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM clashed with al Shabaab Qoryooley. Five al Shabaab arrested.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AS fighters attacked an AMISOM convoy with a roadside mine/IED, destroying two trucks which were carrying goods for the AMISOM base in Ceel Baraf village. The attack took place in an area between Mahaday and Ceel Baraf (22km and 55km NE of Jowhar town respectively) on 12/12. The AMISOM convoy reportedly suffered unspecified further casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab overtakes Mahadaay following a battle with AMISOM forces . At least two casualties. AMISOM forces retook control of the town the following morning without violence.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters launched a fierce attack on an AMISOM base in Buulo Mareer village (28km SW of Marka) in the night of 17/12. The two sides engaged in an intense armed clash that lasted for about an hour. The number of casualties from both sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM convoy, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Jubaland forces, backed by Kenyan forces launch a joint offensive on al Shabaab at Abdale Birole. Coalition forces have reported to have 'suffered causalities,' numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: After an AMISOM convoy comes under attack by remote control IED at Km60 (perpetrators not known), the attacked soldiers open fire on a group of nearby civilians in anger, killing two.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A suspected al Shabaab IED exploded targeted a AMISOM convoy in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) on 29/12. After the explosion, gun-fire was reported. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UN: United Nations
NOTES: An al Shabaab suicide car bomber targeted the Medina gate of Aden Adde airport, detonating near a Halane facility housing AMISOM and UN personnel. AMISOM gunfire responded to the blast. Three deaths reported. Soon after, a second bomber targeted the Peace Hotel, located at the far side of the airport, injuring civilians.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Jubbaland state forces backed by Ethiopian troops serving with AMISOM [African Union Mission in Somalia] have launched a joint military offensive against Al-Shabab bastion near the port city of Kismayo at Singalar and Buulo Gaduud on Friday [6 January]. The allied forces pushed al Shabaab out of the village following a brief gunfight. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Jubbaland state forces backed by Ethiopian troops serving with AMISOM [African Union Mission in Somalia] have launched a joint military offensive against Al-Shabab bastion near the port city of Kismayo at Singalar and Buulo Gaduud on Friday [6 January]. The allied forces pushed al Shabaab out of the village following a brief gunfight. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: African Union [AU] forces have shot and dead two pastoralists and 70 of their camels outside the port city of Barawe in Lower Shabelle region [southern Somalia] on Friday afternoon (6 December 2017). The attacks were an apparent reaction of anger after the convoy hit a landmine in the area. The perpetrators of the IED are not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a Qoryooley police and military bases causing SNG soldiers and AMISOM forces to flee, gaining control of the town briefly. There was no immediate reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A joint SNG-AMISOM operation attacks an al Shabaab location at Diinsoor, killing four.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Somali and Kenyan defence forces have driven out al Shabaab from Nus Dariiq, as well as 'nearby villages which are situated between the towns of Beled Hawo and El Wak.' At least five soldiers reported dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Joint SNG-AMISOM forces take over the al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Saabid and Daarasalaam. Six al Shabaab reported dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Joint SNG-AMISOM forces take over the al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Saabid and Daarasalaam. Six al Shabaab reported dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Joint SNG-AMISOM forces take over the al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Saabid and Daarasalaam. Six al Shabaab reported dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least two people were killed and several injured in a battle between the Somali National Army (SNA) backed by African Union forces and al-Shabaab in Ceel Baraf.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces attack an al Shabaab camp. One AMISOM soldier, three al Shabaab dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM foot patrol ambushed a al Shabaab detachment, 2 al Shabaab killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attack an AMISOM base in Jalalaqsi. casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched a heavy attack on SNAF and AMISOM positions at Afgoye. casualties not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: US and Kenyan forces raid an al Shabaab camp at Buulo Gaduud. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: Kenya forces retake Badhaadhe from al Shabaab following an offensive. At least four al Shabaab and two civilians were killed. The Americans were also involved in the operation. The conquering forces left the town six hours later, allowing for an al Shabaab return.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: Kenya forces retake Badhaadhe from al Shabaab following an offensive. At least four al Shabaab and two civilians were killed. The Americans were also involved in the operation. The conquering forces left the town six hours later, allowing for al Shabaab to return.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AMISOM forces repel an al Shabaab attack on a police post in Afgooye. Nine al Shabaab deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launch a large attack on a KDF base at Kulbiyow. The attackers managed to overtake that base, killing between 51 and 57 soldiers. Military equipment was also reported captured. Despite the majority of reported describing the above, a Lt. Col in the Public Relation's office denied the military and lost control of the base via Twitter. Witnesses put the fatalities at around 40.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces attack on al Shabaab positions in Golweyn. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM KDF troops from Tabto base, while on a security operation, clashed with AS fighters at Jaldeso area (c. 40 km North of Dhobley) on the main Afmadow/Dhobley road. There was an exchange of small arms fire after which AS fighters managed to escape. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM forces clashed with al Shabaab elements at Jaldeso area, 40 km N of Dhobley. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a joint AMISOM-Jubaland patrol at Yoontoy Yarey. Causalities unknown. US forces may have also been present.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters attacked an AMISOM position at Jazeera village, Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which AS withdrew. No reports of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy from Biya-Adde headed towards Mahaday, exploded near Miir -Taqwo village in Mahaday District. There was an exchange of gunfire between AMISOM and AS forces. AMISOM troops were reinforced which forced AS to withdraw from the location. One AMISOM caspir was damaged by the explosion. Two AS fighters were killed and many others were injured. Casualties from AMISOM forces could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Joint AMISOM-SNG forces attack a al Shabaab location at Bariirre. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM base at Arabiiska, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: AS fighters launched several RPG rounds at AMISOM/Burundi base in El-Arbacow in the suburb of Elasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which AS were forces to withdraw. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM foot patrol is ambushed, no fatalities. Al Shabaab retreated westwards.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM checkpoint at K50, no causalities reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: SNA forces, accompanied by Djiboutian Contingent, conducted an operation advancing to Luuq jeelow (approx. 22Km South of Beletweyne town) an area controlled by AS fighters. After reaching the Village they briefly clashed with a small number of AS fighters (that were collecting taxes from the civilians). The SNA forces with DJIBUOTIAN AMISOM took over control of the village, withdrawing after one hour. No casualties were reported from both sides, numbers not listed. AS fighters are suspected to be back in the village, and the situation of that area is now calm.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM and government troops based in Lafole at Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which AS troops withdrew. One dead body, allegedly left behind by AS fighters, was observed outside of the base.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: AS fighters attacked an AMISOM Burundian base in El-Arbacow in the suburb of Elasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which AS were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: At least 57 members of al-Shabab were killed and a large cache of weapons recovered on 02/03 as African Union and Somali forces attacked one of their camps outside Afmadhow. A second source claims that al Shabaab first attacked the soldiers leading to a wider clash. Fatality accounts vary, though both sources acknowledge that the KDF reported 57 al Shabaab dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM KDF and SNA on security patrol at Elbeet, nomadic settlement area approx. 15km N of Husungo village and approx. 65km S of Dhobley. Reportedly there was an exchange of gunfire for about 15 minutes resulting in on injured KDF officer. Al Shabaab escaped from the scene and their casualties' remain unknown. The injured KDF officer was taken to Hosungo AMISOM KDF comp for treatment.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: On 3 March, al Shabaab elements ambushed AMISOM and SNAF troops on patrol at Elbeet (ca.65km south of Dhobley). One Kenyan soldier was reported injured in the exchange of gunfire.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces attack an AMISOM location at Baardheere. A number of AMISOM soldiers were reported dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM convoy between Biyo Cadde and Mahaday district. The two sides exchanged gun fire and the attack was repelled. At least five civilians were killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two civilians are shot and killed in crossfire between warring AMISOM and al Shabaab forces. This event may have occurred on 11/03.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: SNA forces together with AMISOM soldiers who were in security operation attacked an al Shabaab checkpoint in Bulaguduud Village (30km, NE of Kismaayo town). Reportedly the joint forces destroyed the checkpoint and captured an al Shabaab fighter.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab raided an AMISOM defensive base near Qoryoley Bridge. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab attack were repelled. The attack followed the killing of a senior AS combatant earlier in the day in an operation by government forces based in Qoryoley. The body of the AS official was reported to have been dragged around the town by SNA forces.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF launched air & ground raid against al Shabaab in Hola Wajer & Siraare, 31 al Shabaab dead between the two towns.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF launched air & ground raid against al Shabaab in Hola Wajer & Siraare, 31 al Shabaab dead between the two towns.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An Ethiopian convoy retreating from Ceel Buur to Dhuusamareeb was ambushed by al Shabaab at Ceel Qoxle. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Ethiopian AMISOM forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters at Ceel-Qooxle village (c. 75 km South of Dhusamareb and c. 15 km North of Ceel-Buur). The incident occurred after AS fighters ambushed the Ethiopian convoy headed towards Ceel-Buur town. Three AS fighters were killed and one AS officer was arrested. Ethiopian casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED of unknown origin targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated in Shoodey settlement at Mahaday district. Causalities not known. AMISOM troops shot at suspected directions after the explosion killing two civilians travelling in a tricycle (Bajaj) behind the convoy. It was reported that AMISOM troops discovered another IED and safely dismantled it.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked the AMISOM base of Leego. Mortars were first used, then general attack. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy strikes an IED at Cabdow Dibile and K50. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility. Four dead between the two areas. An exchange of gunfire occurred with the attackers following the explosion in Cabdow Dibile.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Goof Gaduud, Bay, early AM: al Shabaab captured Goof Gaduud settlement, 30km north of Baidoa, following a Ethiopian withdrawal. Fierce fighting was reported when Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) launched a counter-attack. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attack a Djibouti base at Jalalaqsi and are quickly repelled. An AMISOM spokesperson said the attackers suffered 'heavy causalities.'

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A Shabaab attacked two Kenya Defence Force (KDF) military bases in Hosingow and Koday. Causalities not articulated. Two al Shabaab reported dead in Koday, including a commander (Bashir Nur Hassan).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A Shabaab attacked two Kenya Defence Force (KDF) military bases in Hosingow and Koday. Causalities not articulated. Two al Shabaab reported dead in Koday, including a commander.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: AMISOM and government forces based in Qoryoley attacked al Shabaab elements at Muduulow (Mashalaay) settlement in Qoryoley district. There was a exchange of gunfire. Three AS fighters were arrested.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM forces patrolling Cabdow Dibile settlement in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire after which AS were forced to withdraw. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: AMISOM and government troops on patrol in Gaawirow settlement (c. 5 km from Qoryoley district) were ambushed by al Shabaab group. There was an exchange of gunfire after which AS were forced to withdraw from the position. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Two Ugandan soldiers are dead, while others are injured during a gun battle with al Shabaab at Gaay Warow.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: 16th April, afternoon, IVO Hosingow, Lower Jubba: a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) placed by al Shabaab. Jubaland forces were also present. The attack was followed by an exchange of gunfire that lasted 40 minutes. Al Shabaab claimed 15 dead, though AMISOM/Jubaland forces claimed four.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Unidentified armed men shot and killed an AMISOM Djiboutian contingent soldier at the Western part of Bulo Burte district (c. 115 km South of Beletweyne). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene with the rifle of the victim. AMISOM Djiboutian contingent forces carried out a security operation after the incident where they arrested a man suspected to be the perpetrator. The suspect was reported to be under detention for further investigation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan AMISOM forces attack and overrun a al Shabaab camp at Badhaadhe with artillery fire and ground forces. 52 al Shabaab reported dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNA and AMISOM convoy, travelling on the road between Leego district and Balidogle, were ambushed by al Shabaab militants. There was an exchange of heavy gun fire. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: AMISOM and government forces capture Bariiree and Marerrey from al Shabaab following an offensive on 23/04. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: AMISOM and government forces capture Bariiree and Marerrey from al Shabaab following an offensive on 23/04. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops, on patrol near Beerta Seeraar in Afgoye district, were ambushed by al Shabaab fighters. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about an hour after which AS withdrew. One AMISOM soldier was killed. Reports of casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab elements ambushed AMISOM and SNA forces on patrol at Garas Jiireed in Qoryoley neighbourhood. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire after which AS escaped. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Early AM, Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab claimed to have killed 'several' AMISOM soldiers during an attack against an AMISOM base in Qoryoley.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambushed ENDF convoy near Halgan, causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A heavy fighting between al Shabaab and Ethiopian forces has erupted near Beledweyne. The fighting broke out at nearby Burdar, after heavily armed al Shabaab ambushed a military convoy ferrying Ethiopian troops. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A heavy fighting between Al Shabaab militants and Ethiopian forces has erupted near Beledweyne. The fighting broke out at nearby Burdar, after heavily armed Al shabaab ambushed a military convoy ferrying Ethiopian troops who were travelling to Buloburte. Two soldiers reported dead in the original attack. Causalities not known. Heavy artillery was reportedly used by al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A military convoy is attacked at Nuur Fanaax. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 29 April, afternoon, Ceel Waregow, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab ambushed an Ugandan African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy. Three soldiers killed, others wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a convoy of Ethiopian troops serving the UN-mandated African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) in Lower Shabelle region on 01/05. The attack began with IED blast, and followed by heavy exchange of gunfire between the militants and the AMISOM soldiers. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AM, Jameeca Cabdi Guray, Bay: unverified media reports suggested an Ethiopian convoy was ambushed by al Shabaab. Resulting causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: KM50, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) base near Kilometre 50. Five al Shabaab dead in the ensuing gunfight. Shabelle Media Network reported AMISOM-Burundi forces were involved. Following the attack on 01/05, al Shabaab forces burned several civilian homes in the area. 'Children' and 'other civilians' died as a result - specific number not revealed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: A day following their surrender at Halgan, al Shabaab force reorganize and launch an attack on the city, only to be repelled. Resulting causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab conducted a hit and run attack against the AMISOM base in Tarak village (c. 60 km South of Adhere District). There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 09 May, c. 1915 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM Burundian military base at El-Arbacow located in the suburbs of Elasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire, consisting of RPGs and mortars, after which AS were forced to withdraw. Casualties and collateral damage could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab has carried out a large-scale attack on a Kenya defence forces convoy in Hosingow area of Lower Jubba region. After the attack on the convoy, heavy exchange of gunfire ensued causing causalities on both sides. Causality numbers not known. There was a follow-up attack the following day.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 10 May, c. 1830 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubaland and AMISOM re-supply convoy at Dad Qumbi (c. 05 km North West of Hosingo town). The convoy was stuck in mud while on transit in Hosingo when they were ambushed by AS. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. A Jubaland soldier succumbed to his injuries and five AMISOM soldiers were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AM, Halgan, Hiiraan: Ethiopian troops attacked a water hole used by al Shabaab, triggering wider skirmishes around Halgan. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 10:30EAT, Garasiyaani, Hiiraan: an Ethiopian convoy travelling towards Beledweyne at Nur Fanah was ambushed by al Shabaab. An IED was used to trigger the ambush. Causalities of warring sides not known. Two civilians reported dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Following an attack on a Kenyan convoy the previous day, al Shabaab launched a follow-up attack in the same area. Causalities reported, numbers not known. Al Shabaab was able to gain control of five Kenyan vehicles.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 13 May, c. 2230 hrs. QORYOLEY: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against government troops and AMISOM base located in Qoryoley town. AS attacked the area from different directions. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for hours after which AS were repelled. Two government soldiers were wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Early AM, Halgan, Hiiraan - al Shabaab attacked an Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) military base. Ethiopians suffered 'heavy loses' - numbers not known. Following the attack al Shabaab took over several parts of the city. Other reports hold the date of attack on 18/05.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab, armed with heavy weapons, attacked an AMISOM/SNAF security outpost in KM 50 Airstrip (c. 20 km West of Afgoye District) and fled the village. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. The attack may have occurred on 28/05.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol from Shalambod to KM50 detonated at El-Waregow village (c. 13 km North East of Merka Town) in Merka District. AMISOM reacted with gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 29 May, afternoon, Halgan, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fighters attacked an Ethiopian military base in Halgan. Causalities figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 02 June, 23:30EAT, Kolbiyow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab briefly captured Kolbiyow from government forces following mortar shelling. Al-Shabab said it killed 10 Somali and Kenyan soldiers in the raid, however, Kenyan military forces claimed 14 al Shabaab dead. (This may have been the total from the retaliatory mission later in the day) Kenyan air and Somali land forces later forced withdrawal the same day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting AMISOM convoy detonated near Buulo Marer town. One AMISOM lorry was damaged by the blast. AMISOM soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspicions directions. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Fighting between Al-Shabaab fighters and Djibouti troops broke out late last night in the town of Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan Region. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: The military and Banadir stabilization troops (AMISOM) special forces clashed at Saybiano vicinity in Hodan district. The special forces attempted to disarm a group of heavily armed soldiers. There was a brief exchange of gunfire. Three civilian bystanders were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12:30EAT, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) base of Mahaday. The assailants were repelled by AMISOM defenders. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM base, KIA unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 09 June, 20:00EAT, KM50, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) base located near KM50. Mortar rounds being fired towards the base were also included during the incident. The attackers were repelled. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Somali forces, AMISOM and US advisors launch a two front joint offensive against the Lower Shabelle al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Aw Dheegle, Janaale and Mubarak, capturing all. The resulting causality figures are not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Somali forces, AMISOM and US advisors launch a two front joint offensive against the Lower Shabelle al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Aw Dheegle, Janaale and Mubarak, capturing all. In Bariire, six al Shabaab fighters and two soldiers were killed and one technical vehicle was destroyed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Somali forces, AMISOM and US advisors launch a two front joint offensive against the Lower Shabelle al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Aw Dheegle, Janaale and Mubarak, capturing all. In Bariire, six al Shabaab fighters and two soldiers were killed and one technical vehicle was destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Somali forces, AMISOM and US advisors launch a two front joint offensive against the Lower Shabelle al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Aw Dheegle, Janaale and Mubarak, capturing all. The resulting causality figures are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Somali forces, AMISOM and US advisors launch a two front joint offensive against the Lower Shabelle al Shabaab held areas of Bariire, Aw Dheegle, Janaale and Mubarak, capturing all. The resulting causality figures are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a probing attack against AMISOM forces at Taabta (c. 60 km East of Dhobley town). AS fighters used small arms fire and several rounds of RPGs after which they retreated from the scene. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Early AM, Baardheere, Gedo: al Shabaab attacked an Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) military base located near Baardheere. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Early AM, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked a Djiboutian base near Jalalaqsi. The perpetrators were repelled. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack, using small arms and RPGs, against AMISOM ENDF contingent position in Qansax-Dheere (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa town). AMISOM forces responded with heavy weapons. A child was reportedly injured by a stray bullet in the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 17 June, evening, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked the Djiboutian forward operating base of Buulo Burto. Causality figures not known. A second attack occurred on 18/06 as well, details not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabab fighters have reportedly attacked an AMISOM [African Union Mission in Somalia] base in Howlwadag area west of Beledweyne with rockets. AMISOM forces responded in kind. No reports of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 18 June, 20:00EAT, Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) military base. The attack injured civilians. Unconfirmed reports indicate a nearby second, Somali government military base was also attacked.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Somali government position at Gabarlaawe in the outskirt of Beletweyne town (c. 7 km South West of Beletweyne city). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire and machine guns that lasted for about 20 minutes. SNA received reinforcements from AMISOM Djiboutian contingent soldiers who manage to repulse Al Shabaab. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM-BNDF base, no reported deaths.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: A joint AMISOM/Somali military operation (US in supervisory role) attacked and gained control of the al Shabaab positions of Cali Fool Dheere and Afrata (Jowhar District) and retook Miir Taqwo without violence. Resulting causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Militia (Pro-Government)
NOTES: Government and AMISOM forces, supported by unidentified anti-al Shabaab troops, carried out a joint operation at Ali Fool dhere and Qurac-Madoobe against al Shabaab bases. Heavy gunfire was heard from the locations. At least three al Shabaab members were killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: A joint AMISOM/Somali military operation (US in supervisory role) attacked and gained control of the al Shabaab positions of Cali Fool Dheere and Afrata (Jowhar District) and retook Miir Taqwo without violence. Resulting causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: AM, Cali Fool Dheere, Middle Shabelle: armed clashes opposed al Shabaab to SNAF and African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) troops. At least six al Shabaab deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Somali and African Union forces on 30/06 recaptured Janale and Mushani from al-Shabaab during a heavy fighting. At least six al Shabaab members and two soldiers were killed in Janaale. Conflicting, al Shabaab asserts victory, claiming the death of several allied soldiers.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Somali and African Union forces on 30/06 recaptured Janale and Mushani from al-Shabaab during a heavy fighting. Causalities not known. Conflicting, al Shabaab asserts victory, claiming the death of several allied soldiers.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A group of al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an AMISOM KDF base at Tabato village (c. 60 km East of Dhobley). AMISOM responded with heavy machine guns after which al Shabaab fighters retreated. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Early AM, Tabta, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) military base. Three soldiers and an unknown number of al Shabaab were killed in the 30 minute exchange. A similar attack in the town took place the previous day.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Military forces attacked al Shabaab fighters concentrated at Birta-Dheere village (c. 11 km South of Garbaharey town). There was an extended armed clash after which SNA withdrew. Initial reports indicated that six military forces were killed and six others were injured in the attack. Earlier in the morning, armed clashes had erupted between security forces and al Shabaab fighters (Birta Dheer, Gedo) during an operation aimed at removing landmines. 14 al Shabaab and 3 government soldiers had died.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: A civilian was killed and three others were injured by AMISOM Djiboutians in Jalalaqsi (c. 180kms South East of Beledweyne town), in a security operation targeting SNA soldiers that injured an AMISOM soldier. The incident that resulted in the injured AMISOM soldier occurred after the Djiboutian soldier attempted to intervene two SNA soldiers. The SNA soldiers exchange gunfire with the AMISOM soldier and the AMISOM soldier was injured in the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 July, 17:45EAT, KM13, Lower Shabelle: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) intercepted at Sinka Dheer's security checkpoint (AMISOM) detonated, killing five and injuring eight. The perpetrator's identity was not provided by the source, though al Shabaab claimed responsibility in the following days. It is not clear if the driver of the car was counted among the dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 16 July, evening, KM50, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) base located near KM50 settlement. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 16 July, evening, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked a Djiboutian military base. The attackers were repelled. Two al Shabaab deaths reported. A secondary report (Calamada in Somali 17 Jul 17) indicated that Djibouti suffered 'heavy causalities.'

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling on the road between Buurane settlement and Mahaday district exploded. The explosion damaged one of the AMISOM trucks. AMISOM reacted with gunfire after the explosion. It is not clear if the attackers were present at the time of the explosion. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: Early AM, IVO Dhobley, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) elements and Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) soldiers killed an al Shabaab leader allegedly behind some of the attacks recently recorded along the Kenyan border. The leader, Hassan Issaq Ibrahim 'Beila', is the alleged ring leader of the al Shabaab cell responsible for several improvised explosive device (IED) attacks against Kenyan forces between Liboi and Dhobley. Two body guards were also killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab overtakes Farlibaax following a firefight with Ethiopian forces. 'Deaths and injuries' reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya); Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: 21 July, afternoon, Buula Gaduud, Lower Jubba: joint security forces including the US temporarily took control of Buula Gaduud before withdrawing back to Yoontoy, approximately 30km north of Kismayo. A second source claims the joint forces 'attacked' the village.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Early AM, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab militants attacked a Djiboutian military base. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known. However, later in the afternoon three Djibouti forces were killed by an IED.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 23 July, 23:00EAT, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fighters attacked a Djiboutian military base. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Early AM, Hosingow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) base. The assailants were repelled. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Early AM, Kolbiyow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked the Kenya Defence Force (KDF) base located near Kolbiyow. KDF forces conducted several sweep operations later this morning as a response to the attack. No causalities reported. The similar attack in the area occurred the previous day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 30 July, c. 2145 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM Djiboutian contingent base located at the West of Bulo Burte district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about five minutes after which AS withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 10:00EAT, Marka - Buulo Mareer road, Lower Shabelle: an al Shabaab ambush of an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy escalated into wider skirmishes. Al Shabaab claims 51 Ugandan forces killed in the battle, though some believe this figure is exaggerated. They further claim 'top' commanders were killed in the battle. Ugandan forces claim 12 dead. Wider reports suggest the number is between 20-25.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM base of Arbacow. Mortars used as trigger of the attack, followed by small arms fire. Causality numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al-Shabab mujahedeen movement fighters have attacked Djibouti troops' base in Bulo-berde district the night of 05/08. Casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 07th August, afternoon, IVO Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: a Burundi joint security forces convoy was ambushed by al Shabaab. An improvised explosive device (IED) was used to trigger the ambush. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: After a joint government/AMISOM convoy is attacked by al Shabaab, the forces respond and overtake Cali Fool Dheere. Causality numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked the Burundi forward operating base of Cali Fool Dheere. RPG and small arms fire recorded. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for attack on ENDF base in Halgan. Casualty figures and incident unverified.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 12th August, afternoon, IVO Luuq, Gedo: al Shabaab ambushed an Ethiopian convoy. The assailants were repelled, no reported causalities. This event may have occurred on 11/08.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: AM, IVO Gaduud (near Yoontoy Yarey), Lower Jubba: al Shabaab ambushed a joint security forces convoy, including Jubaland, AMISOM and possible US forces. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM base in Mashalay settlement (c. 07 km South East of Qoryoley district). There was an exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Armed al Shabaab attackers ambushed an AMISOM convoy travelling between Golweyn and Buulo Mareer areas. An explosion was reported. Causality number not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM/government case at Bulo Mareer. The attackers were repelled. There was not a causality report.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM base near Qoryoley. Assailants repelled, no casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED buried beside the road along Qurac Madoobe neighbourhood exploded on an AMISOM convoy between Cali Fooldhere and Mahaday areas in Mahaday district. The explosion damaged an AMISOM truck. AMISOM troops and al Shabaab fighters at the location allegedly exchanged gunfire. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab were reported to have launched an attack against base manned by Djibouti peacekeepers in Bulo Burto. There was no immediate confirmation of the casualties from both sides. However, Somali military officials reported attack repulsed by the African Union forces.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an AMISOM Djiboutian contingent base at the bridge located at the centre of Jalalaqsi town. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about five minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabab fighters reportedly attacked AMISOM base in Shalambood village 9 kms West of Marka District. AMISOM forces repelled the attack forcing al Shabaab to withdraw from the area. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AM, Golweyn, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab claimed to have captured Golweyn from AMISOM after several rounds of attacks against security bases. Causalities from the operations not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNA base at Halane vicinity in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. At least two civilians were injured by stray bullets.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab backed news sources reports the group attacked Djibouti forces at Jalalaqsi the night of 28/08. Members of the Djibouti forces 'may' have suffered fatalities (coded as 10).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 29 Aug, c. 1530 hrs. An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated near Buulo Marer town. An AMISOM lorry was damaged by the blast. AMISOM soldiers shot towards suspected directions of the attack. Two civilians killed in the crossfire. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: AM, Golweyn - Buulo Mareer road, Lower Shabelle: a Uganda African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). The convoy was subsequently engaged in small arms fire. Overall causality figures are not known, though it is believed that at least two civilians were killed in the crossfire. Shabelle Radio Network reports the attack took place on 29/08.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Early AM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan region: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) military base. Government forces, along with AMISOM, repelled the attack, incurring 'losses and injuries' to al Shabaab. Government/AMISOM causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Local Security forces and ENDF attacked an al Shabaab position in a village (not named) outside Buurhakaba town (c. 60 km South East of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabab managed to escape. After a short stay at the location, the security forces returned to their base in Buurhakaba town. There were no reports of casualties. The government is said to be in control of the town.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab claimed to have killed two AMISOM soldiers during an ambush near Ceel Waregow. No independent verification. Calamada reports the attack occurred on 06/09.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab claimed its fighters attacked a Djiboutian base near Buulo Burto. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab fighters stormed the village of Burane, situated outside Mahaday, attacking a Burundian military base there. Al-Shabaab technical [pickup trucks mounted with machine-guns] participated in the attack, which lasted nearly two hours. Damage reported to some fortifications of Burundian troops, and it is believed that they suffered fatalities and injuries. The attack occurred on either 08/09 or 09/09. A third source claims 08/09.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambush UPDF convoy, no casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A hand grenade was hurled at AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol at the Livestock Market vicinity in Heliwa district. The soldiers reacted with gunfire. One bystander was killed while three others, including one child, were injured. The perpetrator managed to escape unidentified. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM soldiers on security patrol at Libaanta channel near the main bridge in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers were repelled. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabab has launched attacks on a base belonging to government forces and AMISOM troops in the locality of Jalalaqsi in Hiiraan Region [central Somalia]. Reports indicate that the sound of both heavy and light firearms being exchanged by the warring sides could be heard in the area. Reports indicate there were causalities on the al Shabaab side, numbers not known (divided among the two days). The attack began late on 13/09 and ended the following morning.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Early AM, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle region: al Shabaab attacked a Burundian National Defence Force (BNDF) military base. Several soldiers were reported injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabab has launched attacks on a base belonging to government forces and AMISOM troops in the locality of Jalalaqsi in Hiiraan Region [central Somalia]. Reports indicate that the sound of both heavy and light firearms being exchanged by the warring sides could be heard in the area. Reports indicate there were causalities on the al Shabaab side, numbers not known (divided among the two days). The attack began late on 13/09 and ended the following morning.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched an attack on Garbahaarey on the evening of 15/09. The attack started with a [suicide] car bomb hitting the main entrance of a Somali army base in south Garbahaarrey. Al-Shabab fighters, who had been waiting outside, then launched a large-scale attack on the base. A fierce fighting is currently underway at the base, with the two sides battling each other with heavy weapons. Ethiopian forces, aiding the government launched mortar fire on al Shabaab positions outside the city. Causality figures not known at this time.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked BNDF base near Burane. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 23rd September, PM, IVO Belet Xaawo, Gedo: Reports of fighting between AMISOM and al Shabaab, 6km from Kenya's Mandera town. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy en route to Yoontoy. Casualties unknown. An IED possibly initiated the ambush.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Joint SNA/ENDF strike operation carried out at Baardheere, 25 al Shabaab reported killed including members of the al Shabaab leadership.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters have attacked Southwest state forces and African Union troops at military bases at Goof Guduud. Causalities not known. The attack may have occurred the previous day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched mortar shells against Diinsoor airstrip. Ethiopian forces, stationed at the airfield responded in kind against the al Shabaab position. Causalities not known. A secondary source claims the attack took place on the previous day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab media claims to have attacked Ethiopian forces in Waajid district, causing 'huge' causalities. A second report claims one ENDF dead, one wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Early AM, Qoryoley main bridge, Lower Shabelle - al Shabaab attack the joint AMISOM/SNAF base located near Qoryoley's main bridge. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al-Shabab has seized a ENDF military truck carrying supplies at Budada. No details of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A AMISOM soldier kills a civilian. The soldier may have been stabbed by a third unidentified actor prior to the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unconfirmed local sources have reported that an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy has been hit by an IED IVO Lambar KM60 (Marka). An exchange of gunfire followed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Fatalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired an unspecified number of mortar shells at the AMISOM base at Arbacow settlement in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat from the area. Fatalities could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked SNAF base in Qoryoley. AMISOM deployed QRF. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM/SNAF base near Mashalaay. Assailants repelled. Casualty figures unknown. A second attack was reported two days later.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab media claims attacks on AMISOM bases in Mashaaley and Danow. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM and SNA forces at Mashalay settlement outside of Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew from the location. Casualties not be ascertained at the time of reporting. The exchange may have occurred on the previous day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy travelling at Ceelwareegow near Marka district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED attack on an AMISOM convoy escalates in wider clashes between al Shabaab and AMISOM. Civilian casualties are reported, numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An African Mission in Somalia (AMSIOM) convey was hit by an al Shabaab road side IED, with a reported secondary device detonating on the disembarkation of AMISOM troops. Reports claim small arms fire followed the IED strike resulting in an unknown number people killed - - locals claim 10 civilians died in the blasts and ensuing gunfire. Among the dead included a journalist. Dalsan Radio reports 20 deaths.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Limited unconfirmed reporting claimed that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have engaged al Shabaab in Baraawe. No known causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Limited unconfirmed reporting claims that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have engaged al Shabaab in the town of Buulo Mareer. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Local unconfirmed reporting has stated that the AMISOM base in Qooryoley had been attacked by al Shabaab. At present details remain limited.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab combatants attacked AMISOM troops at Mashalay settlement outside of Qoryoley district. The clash was initiated with a mortar attack following heavy exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew from the area. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab position near Bali Doogle airport. Causalities not known. The attack is part of a wider offensive in the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 08th November, PM, Basra, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed local sources have claimed that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have been attacked by al Shabaab Militants. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Minister of Information Abdirahman Omar Osman has released a statement that joint SNA and AMISOM operations have killed 81 members of al Shabaab. Al Shabaab denied the attack took place. The date(s) of the attack were not provided by the source. Source dated 11/11.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Unconfirmed local reports have stated that low level fighting has occurred between al Shabaab and Ethiopian National Defence forces (ENDF) on the outskirts of Hudur. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab combatants fired three mortar shells at the AMISOM base at Ambareeso area (c. 05 km North of Barawe district). The mortar rounds landed on an empty place in the camp resulting in no human fatalities. Following the barrage, al Shabaab forces attack the village with small-arms fire, but were rebuffed by the AMISOM forces. Causalities not known from the small-arms exchange.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Armed al Shabaab combatants attacked SNA and AMISOM troops at Qoryoley Police Station and main bridge settlements in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about two hours after which AS were forced to withdraw. At least three SNA soldiers and two civilian bystanders were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 23rd November, AM, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Limited unconfirmed reports have stated al Shabaab have ambushed a Somali National Army (SNA) and AMISOM patrol killing three.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 24th November, ivo Bulo Mareer: AMISOM troops ambushed, 4 killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Joint African Mission on Somalia (AMISOM) and Somali National Army (SNA) forces carry out offensive operation against an al Shabaab location. Causality figures not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 27th November, 2000L, Dhobley, Lower Jubba: KDF convoy ambushed near the town of Dhobley. The attack was initiated with an IED explosion then followed by small arms fire. At least two KDF dead. The attack may have been a reaction to recent Kenyan offensives against al Shabaab in the nearby Boni Forest, Kenya.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM soldier on foot patrol at Danow neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces attack a joint AMISOM/Jubaland base in Hosingow during the late night hours. Reliable sources say that the Kenyan forces suffered casualties including deaths (numbers not provided) and injuries in the 28 November night attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 29th November, 2120L, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: Reports of RPG and small arms attack on a African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) position. Al Shabaab responsible. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 2nd December, multiple settlements, Beledwenye, Hiiraan: Joint Somali National Army (SNA) and African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops carry out security offensive against al Shabaab. Casualties and outcome of the operation are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 03rd December, 1200L, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) position just outside Qoryooley. 'A number' of al Shabaab causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: AMISOM convoy from Afgooye struck by IED near Gandawi. Convoy subsequently ambushed for 20 minutes by al Shabaab. Two AMISOM soldiers injured, one truck damaged by second explosion.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 04th December, 1400L, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Following on from 03rd December attack launched by al Shabaab, unconfirmed local reports have stated that AMISOM have ambushed militants ivo Qoryooley. 'A number' of al Shabaab causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: 05th December, AM, Dhoobley, Afmadow, Lower Jubba: Al Shabaab launched an attack on an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM)/Jubaland base on the border town of Dhoobley. It is possible that this was a diversionary attack to facilitate an attack into Kenya. Causalities not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
