NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF convoy travelling from Mogadishu to FOB Shalambood near Ceel Waregow. 25 minutes gunfire before assailants retreated. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 09th December, AM, Gansahdera, Qansah Dhere, Bay: Al Shabaab launch an attack against Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) base. The ENDF forces repelled the attack. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 11th December, AM, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab have launched an attack against an AMISOM position. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: In an effort to blockade Belet Weyne al Shabaab attack ENDF forces at Eel-gal. The fighting lasted 30 minutes. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al-Shabab fired mortar bombs at an Ethiopian military base in Wajid, Bakool region, in southwest Somalia on Sunday [31 December] night. Ethiopian troops at the base launched retaliatory strikes against the attackers. No immediate causality report.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM on foot patrol at Danow neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 01st January, AM, Wajid, Bakool: Unconfirmed reports state that al Shabaab have launched an attack against an Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) position near Wajid. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an AMISOM base at Halane neighbourhood in Qoryooley district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy headed to Jowhar town, detonated at Farah Gololey village (c. 45 km north of Mogadishu city). An AMISOM truck was damaged by the blast. AMISOM troops reacted with gunfire towards adjacent sides of the tarmac. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrator not named by the source.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 09th January, PM, El Adde, Hiiran: Unconfirmed reports claim that ENDF have launched an attack against al Shabaab. The outcome of the attack is not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: An SNA and AMISOM ENDF contingent joint operation from Beletweyne town were attacked by al Shabaab fighters at Indhacaad area (c. 30 km North East of Beletweyne town). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. The motive of the operation was to clear the main supply routes along Beletweyne, Matabaan and Maxaas that was blocked by al Shabaab fighters. There were no reports of causalities. SNA commander, through the media, stated that al Shabaab were forced to retreat to several villages and confirmed that the operation was ongoing.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 10 January 2018: Somali Military forces assisted by AMISOM: African Union mission in Somalia, launched a clean-up operation to clear road barriers between Beledweyne Mahaas and Mataban towns. They also eliminated Al Shabaab militants from their hideouts at some locations.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Green and green violence reported in Ceel Waaq. One soldier death reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 16th January, Toratorow, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated a joint AMISOM SNA security operation has resulted in the death of an al Shabaab commander and the wounding of Iqri Cubyed, a prominent militant explosives expert. A second report holds five deaths.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: 18th January, AM, Kismayo, Lower Jubba: A Kenyan Defence Force (KDF) convoy which was reportedly carrying U.S. troops is hit by a roadside Radio Controlled Improvised Explosive Devices (RCIED). The detonation of the RCIED was followed by a firefight. Casualty numbers are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attack Djiboutian base in Buulo Burto. Assailants repelled, three militants killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Afgoye to Shalamboot, exploded at Ceel Waregow village (c. 12 km north east of Merka town) in Merka district. One AMISOM truck was damaged. AMISOM reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Somali security forces backed by Africa Union troops killed three Al-Shabaab militants and injured several others during a heavy fighting in Bula-burte town in Hiiraan region.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM and suspected al Shabaab fighters clashed at KM60 village (c. 30 km west of Afgoye). The attack was initiated using RPGs followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab were repelled. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: An RCIED, buried alongside the road to Jowhar and Balcad targeting an AMISOM/SNA convoy, exploded at Haan Sheekh neighbourhood (c. 12 km north east of Balcad district). Heavy gunfire followed. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched an attack on AMISOM forces at Bulo Mareer on the night of 26/01. Heavy weapons were used. Casualities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/SNA troops based at Bullo-Mareer neighbourhood in Kurtunwarey district. The clash was initiated with RPG rounds followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes. Three SNA soldiers were injured. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit- and-run attack against an AMISOM base at Halane neighbourhood in Qoryooley district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: An al-Shabab commander has been killed in a joint operation in Raxoole.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF foot patrol. Casualties reported, figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy near number 60 vicinity (c. 30 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least four al Shabaab militants were killed and five others were injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AMISOM ENDF and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Ilkacade area (c. 12 km north of Beletweyne) on the MSR which links Beletweyne to the northern regions of Somalia. The incident occurred after al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM ENDF who were travelling from Ethiopia to Beletweyne. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. Casualties could not be determined at the time of reporting. AMISOM ENDF reached Beletweyne after the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attack forward operating base Cali Fool Dheere with PKM and RPG7. No casualties, assailants repelled.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy traveling on the road between KM 50 and KM 60 near Buulo-Nageey village (c. 20 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 08/02, PM, Gaal, Beledweyne: EDNF ambush al Shabaab. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attack AMISOM forward operating base Masilah. RPGs fired. No casualties, assailants repelled.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab forces have attacked a base belonging to AMISOM troops in the coastal district of Barawe at Ambareeso, Lower Shabelle region on the night of 13/02. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab fighters have carried out attacks on AMISOM [Africa Union Mission in Somalia] soldiers in their camps in Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The raids happened on AMISOM camps in Qoryoley and Bilal villages. Several [AMISOM] killed and injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab fighters have carried out attacks on AMISOM [Africa Union Mission in Somalia] soldiers in their camps in Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The raids happened on AMISOM camps in Qoryoley and Bilal villages. Several [AMISOM] killed and injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambush KDF patrol after premature detonation of an IED. Three al Shabaab killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 18th February, AM, near Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that joint SNA and AMISOM troops have carried out an offensive on al Shabaab locations around Baraawe. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 19th February, PM, IVO Bulo Gaduud, Kismayo Lower Jubba: A roadside IED disables an AMISOM convoy vehicle prior to an al Shabaab ambush at Yoontoy and Bulo Gaduud. Causalities not known in both instances.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 19th February, PM, IVO Bulo Gaduud, Kismayo Lower Jubba: A roadside IED disables an AMISOM convoy vehicle prior to an al Shabaab ambush at Yoontoy and Bulo Gaduud. Causalities not known in both instances.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: Armed clashes reported between al Shabaab fighters and joint US/IJA/AMISOM forces. Resulting casualty figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab militants ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving along Baledogle road at Baqdaad village (c. 10 km north west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. The convoy managed to pass through the area, Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 20 Feb, c. 1120 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy traveling on the road between Ceel Waregow and Shalambood near Ceel Waregow village (c. 07 km north east of Merka district). There was an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack stating that they targeted an AMISOM convoy transporting military supplies to Shalambood. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 21st February, PM, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: Unconfirmed local reporting has claimed that joint AMISOM and SNA security forces are carrying out an offensive operation against the militant controlled town of Jamaame. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM KDF Contingent force position in Qoqani village (c. 90 km east of Dhobely town). Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds and small arms fire from a distance to the direction of the base. AMISOM forces responded with small arms fire and machine guns. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 22nd February, AM, Bardheere, Gedo: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab have launched an attack against Ethiopian National Defence Forces (ENDF). Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambush a joint AMISOM/SNAF convoy outside of Kismayo, possibly including US advisors. Casualty figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Armed clashes continued between al Shabaab and joint security forces. Casualty figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Ugandan AMISOM forces shot and killed three Somali government forces following large bombing attacks on two sections of the city. The action may have been an instance of confusion following the blasts.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
NOTES: 23rd February, 2040L, Waaberi: AMISOM forces shoot and kill two NISA officers and two civilians after a NISA officers had stopped AMISOM armoured vehicle on airport road checkpoint close to KM4.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNA troops clashed with a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters at Embareeso village (c. 05 km north of Afgoye district). Exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the suspected al Shabaab members withdrew. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: Armed clashes oppose AMISOM/SNAF and al Shabaab near Embresso airfield. Initiator unknown. Al Shabaab withdrew after 30min long firefight. Resulting casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF conducts route clearance operation between Dhobley and Afmadow, claims four militants killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Government forces, jointly with KDF, attack an al Shabaab position near Faafax Dhuun. At least 23 al Shabaab reported dead. A second report claims 25 dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 28 February 2018: Somali Army backed up by AMISOM: Ethiopian forces recaptured the town in Hiiraan region. They faced heavy resistance from Al Shabaab which resulted in unidentified number of casualties. Al Shabaab had been controlling the town since 2016.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 02 March. At least three BNDF soldiers are killed in an al Shabaab attack near Jowhar. The attack took place during the late morning hours.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
NOTES: 02 March 2018: Al Shabaab carried out three separate attacks around Mogadishu. AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia, escorted by Burundian troops, was targeted in Balad, 50 km from Mogadishu. Three soldiers were killed, three wounded, many others missing and 17 vehicles of the Burundi convoy of AMISOM were damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 02 March. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy near Haansheekh village. At least 5 BNDF soldiers dead. Al Shabaab radio claimed 23 BNDF dead. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 03 March. Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds at a AMISOM base in Laantabuur. AMISOM forces responded in kind. No reports of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 07 March. c. 1410 hrs. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy passing at Ceel Waregow village. Causalities not known. Following the ambush, the AMISOM convoy hit an IED in the area. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the second attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 09 March. Al Shabaab and AMISOM forces exchanged a volley of mortars and small arms fire in the Embareso area. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 10 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack against AMISOM forces in Baraawe. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 11 March. Al Shabaab launch an attack against an Ethiopian AMISOM troop position in Baardheere. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 March. Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM position in Golweyn. A civilian was injured by a stray bullet. Al Shabaab retreated.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 13 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack against AMISOM forces near Qansahdhere. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia); Pastoralists (Somalia)
SOURCE: Shabelle Media Network; Somali Memo; Undisclosed Source
NOTES: 16 March. Al Shabaab clashed with ENDF and Somali government forces in Bulale area near Maxaas. The fight started between Herders and Al Shabaab as Al Shabaab tried to put taxes on the Herders. The government reported 32 al Shabaab dead following the gunfight.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 17 March. Armed clashes continue at Maxaas between AMISOM and AS. Additional causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 17 March. Al Shabaab ambush an AMISOM convoy in Yurkud. The attack was initiated by an IED. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 19 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM and government forces in Buurdhuubo. A second source states 5 al Shabaab dead. Shabelle Media Network reports they al Shabaab overtook the town, but vacated on their own accord later in the day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 20 March. SNA and AMISOM forces conducted an operation against al Shabaab positions outside Buulogudud village at Singaler/Wirkoy and Sabcasharaf areas. The forces clashed with al Shabaab. After a brief exchange of gunfire, al Shabaab fighters retreated. No reports of possible casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 24 March. Armed clashes erupt between al Shabaab and Djiboutian forces near Belet Weyne. Resulting casualty figures are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 24 or 25 March. Government and AMISOM forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab hideouts in North and East of the region. The forces clashed at Hees area. Six al Shabaab fighters killed and two soldiers injured. One of the killed al Shabaab members is reportedly Ali Ahmed Gure, the head of al Shabaab Zakawat in North and East of Hiraan region.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 29 March. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM-BNDF convoy travelling from Mahaday to Cali Fooldhere settlement in Mahaday district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire. Casualties not known. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 30 March. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM convoy in Jowhar. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 31 March. Armed clashes erupt between Djiboutian troops and al Shabaab fighters near Belet Weyne. Outcome unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
SOURCE: Goobjoob; Shabelle Media Network; Undisclosed Source; Radio Risala
NOTES: 01 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked two (possibly multiple) AMISOM bases at Buulo-Marer and Golweyn settlements in Kurtunwarey district. A VBIED advanced towards Golweyn but AMISOM soldiers fired towards the vehicle destroying it. Causalities not known. The second incident involved two VBIEDs approaching an base at Buulo-Marer. One VBIED managed to infiltrate the base and detonated. Afterwards, there was an exchange of small arms fire between AMISOM and al Shabaab. AMISOM troops repelled the attack. At least four AMISOM soldiers and 22 al Shabaab were killed. Ammunition was also confiscated by AMISOM troops. AMISOM claims 30 al Shabaab dead; a Somali official claims 66 dead; numbers widely varied. The most common figure in the days following the attack is 59.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 01 April. A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving near Hanshiekh, Balcad district. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 01 April. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM base in Qoryooley, 6 al Shabaab attackers reported dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 01 April. A low level attack was launched by al Shabaab on an AMISOM base in Beled Amin. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 02 April. SNA troops and AMISOM Burundian contingent clashed at Jowhar Airport. The incident occurred after a plane carrying khat landed in Jowhar airport and SNA troops, alleged to be loyal to one businessman involved in the khat business, entered into the airport and open fire against the AMISOM Burundian forces. One AMISOM solider killed, two others wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 05 April. Al Shabaab ambushed a KDF reinforcement convoy from Tabta at Jaldesa (c. 42 km east of Dhobley). The group was travelling to aid following an IED attack in the area. No reported causality.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 10 April. Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base in Ambareeso Settlement located outside Barawe district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 11 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack UPDF defensive position near Baraawe. Resulting casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 April. Al Shabaab combatants attacked an AMISOM convoy moving near Danow settlement at Buulo Marer town. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 12 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF convoy travelling to Buulo Mareer, near Danow. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 17 April. Combined Jubaland/Kenyan forces overtake al Shabaab forces in Qoqani, after it have been under their control 'for several hours.' No Jubaland/Kenya causality, though witness claimed to have seen 'dead bodies' of al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 23 April. Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM Burundian troop base at Arbacow vicinity (c. 15 km west of Mogadishu in Afgoye district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 24 April. Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM-Uganda forces in Ceelasha Biyaha during the early morning hours. There were no immediate reports on casualties, however al Shabaab said in a statement that its fighters inflicted 'heavy casualties' on the AMISOM troops. Enemy casualties are often embellished inflated by al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 24 April. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Merka to Afgoye, exploded at Buullo Naagad village near Kelicafimaad, 18 north of Merka. There was an exchange of gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and government forces. The lead vehicle of the convoy was damaged and two AMISOM soldiers were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 25 April. Al Shabaab forces ambush a group of AMISOM-Uganda soldiers at Ceel Waregow. An exchange of gunfire followed. An unknown number of causalities reported on both sides.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force; AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 27 April. US, Jubaland and Kenyan forces attack an al Shabaab base at Bar Sanguni, 45km north of Kismayo. 30 al Shabaab dead. Al Shabaab claimed they had inflicted losses on the allied forces, but did not provide numbers.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 03 May. Somali government forces backed by African Union troops have captured the strategic town of Baidoa from al Shabaab. A soldier was killed and three others were wounded in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 10 May. Al Shabaab elements attacked AMISOM and SNA troops positioned at Xero Labaad and police station neighbourhoods in Qoryole district. The joint forces managed to repel the attackers. Three al Shabaab attackers were killed and three civilian passers-by were injured in the clashes. Casualties from the Government and AMISOM were not reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
NOTES: 12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)

Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
NOTES: 13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 13 May. An RCIED, buried alongside the road linking Jowhar and Balcad and targeting an AMISOM/SNA convoy, exploded at Gololey village neighbourhood (c. 16 km north east of Balcad district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire thereafter. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 24 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a KDF patrol near Afmadow. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 26 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a SNAF patrol near Cusman Qule. Assailants retreat after a 20 minute firefight, and the intervention of UPDF forces, who shell the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 28 May. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy transporting supplies from Golweyne to Shalambood, exploded at Bullo Mareer town neighbourhood in Merka district. One supply lorry was damaged. There was an exchange of gunfire between AMISOM and al Shabaab which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 30 May. Al Shabaab attack a Uganda base in Baraawe. Assailants repelled.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 30 May. Al Shabaab attack a Uganda military base in Buulo Mareer. Assailants repelled.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 01 June. Al Shabaab attacks a government forces base in Moqokori, later claiming 60 SNG dead. Al Shabaab overtook the area. Al Shabaab updated their figure the following week, claiming 72 confirmed deaths. Ethiopian forces were also involved.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 02 June. Al Shabaab attacked and overran an AMISOM base in Shalaambood. Casualties not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's 'Ramadan campaign.'

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 02 June. Al Shabaab attacked a AMISOM-Uganda base in Amabareson village outside the port town of Barawe. Casualties not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's 'Ramadan campaign.'

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 02 June. Al Shabaab forces launched an attack on an AMISOM base in Qoryooley during the nighttime hours. Causalities not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's 'Ramadan campaign.'

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 03 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF base located near a KDF base in Kolbiyow. Assailants repelled. One injured militant reportedly arrested.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 05 June. Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Baraawe and Qoryooley on 05/06. Causality figures remain unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 05 June. Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Baraawe and Qoryooley on 05/06. Causality figures remain unknown.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-); Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
NOTES: 09 June 2018: Al Shabaab attacked Somali National Army, AMISOM and United States Army near Sunguuni, Lower Juba region. No information on fatalities.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 09 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint in Lafoole. In response, nearby Ugandan forces shelled al Shabaab locations. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 June. Reports state that RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu from Jowhar town detonated at the Ilbaq settlement between Qalimow village and Ceelka Geelow village under Balcad District (Middle Shabelle region) followed by gunfire. One of the APCs in the convoy was reportedly damage and one soldier was injured. Perpetrators likely al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 June. Report stated that al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM base in KM 50 village Settlement (approx. 22km, Southwest of Afgoye District). Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers retreated.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 20 June. Reports state that a RCIED targeting AMISOM supply convoy from Mogadishu heading to Jowhar town detonated at the Eggero settlement between Gololey and Garsaale village under Balcad District (Middle Shabelle region) followed by gunfire. One vehicle was reportedly damaged. One soldier was reported injured by the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 22 June. Reports stated that a RCIED buried along the roadside targeted AMISOM forces (consist of 9 battle wagons) at the Warmahan village neighbourhood, Afgoye District. After RCIED blast, al Shabaab engaged the forces in a well-organized direct ambush attack against Convoy which began with rocket propelled grenades (RPGs) followed by heavy gunfire which lasted about one hour after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. Two Vehicles were destroyed by IED explosion and RPG fired by al Shabaab militants. At least 11 people including soldiers and al Shabaab were killed in the fight.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 23 June. A 15 minutes exchange of gunfire between AMISOM/SNA troops and a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters was reported at Embareeso village located 5km North of Afgoye district. The attack began with mortar shells fire towards AMISOM SNA bases followed by light gunfire which ensued for about 15 minutes after which suspected al Shabaab militants withdrew.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 28 June. A Djiboutian convoy was struck by an IED in the outskirts of Jalalaqsi. Incident initiated a larger al Shabaab ambush. The resulting casualty figures are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 30 June. Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM-Uganda base at K60. Fighting was reported as 'heavy.' Causalities reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 02 July. A senior Somali regional district official stated that AMISOM and government forces have captured an Al-Shabaab commander during a joint security operation on the outskirt of Qoryoley town. Other militants also arrested.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area between Adado and Xarardheere at Caad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 05 July. Reports indicated that the al Shabaab combatants attacked AMISOM and Government forces positions in Halane neighbourhoods, in Qoryoley District. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire for a couple of hours. Al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. At least three people including one soldier and two al Shabaab militants were reportedly killed in the clash.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area at Caad between Adado and Xarardheere at Aad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area at Caad between Adado and Xarardheere at Aad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 08 July. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy headed to Jowhar town, exploded at Ilbaq settlement near Gololey village in Balcad district. It was report that two sequence explosions were heard followed by gunfire. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 22 July. Al Shabaab militants travelling in four small boats along the coastline conducted an attack against AMISOM/SNA troops at Barawe Seaport neighbourhood in Barawe district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for over 30 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On 27 July, two remotely detonated explosive devices reportedly targeted an AMISOM (unidentified country of origin) convoy at the Ilbaq settlement near Gololey village in Balcad district. Gunfire reportedly followed the the explosions. Al-Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: On 28 July, Al Shabaab militants reportedly conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM Burundian troops based at Arbacow (15 KM west of Moghadishu) in Afgoye district. RPG, mortar, and gunfire lasted for around 30 minutes after which Al-Shabaab militiamen withdrew. No injuries or fatalities were reported by the source.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On 29 July, armed fighters with links to Al-Shabaab reportedly raided an AMISOM military base in Arba'ow area near Elasha Biyaha village, just outside of Mogadishu. No info on casualties.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
NOTES: On 30 July 2018, a Burundian army officer on a peacekeeping mission in Somalia was found dead in Gersaale, near Joar. The official statement of the AMISOM Burundi contingent mentions that he committed suicide, but his colleagues say that he was executed.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: On 3 August, Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed a convoy of Kenyan troops traveling from Garilley area to Fahfadhun, Gedo Region. According to the report, the ambush began with landmine explosions after which fighters began firing weapons at the troops. The source did not provide any information on casualties.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: On 3 August, Somali and Djiboutian AMISOM forces engaged in clashes with Al-Shabaab militants who had attacked the town of Jalaqsi overnight. The brief exchange of gunfire resulted in the death of at least one local militiaman who was fighting alongside the Somali troops.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 04 August. Al Shabaab attacked HirShabelle and AMISOM forces on the edge of Jalalaqsi. A HirShabelle soldier was killed before attackers withdrew.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 4 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a convoy of AMISOM troops (nationality unknown) headed from Lanta Buuro to KM50, firing an RPG at the convoy that had stopped near the Wareegow village located 13km North-East of Merka District. The two sides reportedly traded gunfire for about 30 minutes until Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 5 August 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked militants have reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Ugandan) in the vicinity of the town of Arbacow, Afgooye district. According to the report, artillery, RPG, and gun fire were all used during the attack. No info on casualties. *note: Relief-web identifies the Arbacow base as being in or near Ceelasha Biyaha area.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 7 August 2018: Fighters linked to Al-Shabaab launched an attack on a Djiboutian base in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran district. According to the report, clashes were fought throughout the night, and an explosion at the airport during the fighting killed and wounded Djiboutian soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 7 August 2018: Clashes between Somali National Army troops backed by AMISOM forces on one side and Al-Shabaab militiamen on the other were reportedly fought in Gaaywarow, Qoryooley district. 7 civilians and a single AMISOM soldier were wounded during the clashes, while 5 AS militiamen were killed and 5 injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 8 August 2018: AMISOM troops reportedly attacked AS positions in Awgoye (located 10 km north of Afgoye). After a brief exchange of gunfire both parties withdrew from the area. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

NOTES: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 8 August 2018: Joint Somali National Amry troops and Amisom forces reportedly took control of Gaywirow village, Qoryooley district in Lower Shabelle Region after clashing with militants linked to Al-Shabaab. No info on casualties.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: August 9 2018: 7 Ugandan soldiers were reportedly killed in an ambush set by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the outskirts of Qoryoley town, Qoryoley District, Lower Shabelle region.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 9 August 2018: Somali national forces backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly engaged Al-Shabaab militants in clashes in Awqoy village, located 30 km from Afgoye town (direction/location unknown). No info on casualties.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 13 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Djiboutian) west of Bulo Burte district, Hiran region. After a short exchange of gunfire AS forces retreated back into the bush. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 17 August 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab militiamen reportedly ambushed a convoy of AMISOM soldiers (Ugandan) travelling through the Gandawe settlement, Marka district. According to the report, AS militiamen first targeted the lead vehicle with an IED blast, then fired machine gun and small arms fire at the AMISOM troops. Three soldiers were reported injured as a result of the attack.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 19 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers (SNA), backed by AMISOM troops, reportedly repelled an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab forces on newly-captured areas of Marka town, Lower Shabelle region. The source did not provide any info on casualties. SNA soldiers took new areas of Marka town during armed clashes on the 18 August 2018.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 21 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants and Somali National Army troops backed by AMISOM forces in Marka traded gunfire for around 4 hours. Local sources stated that 7 civilians were injured in the incident.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 25 August 2018: Al-Shabab fighters in Lower Shabelle region reportedly attacked African Union forces travelling outside El Wareegow area near Marka town, sparking armed clashes. Injuries were reported but no fatalities were specified by the source.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 27 August 2018: Joint Somali National Army and AMISOM forces conducted an operation against Al Shabaab insurgents in Marka town. During the fighting a Russian insurgent Abdi Nasir Asar-bajan was killed and 10 others captured.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 28 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly ambushed a convoy of Somali and African Union troops as they left Marka town for Mogadishu. According to the pro-al-Shabaab source, 4 soldiers were killed and several others wounded.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 28 August 2018: According to pro- Al-Shabaab sources, fighters loyal to the group attacked an Ethiopian military base in Garbaharaay town, Gedo region, using gunfire and mortar rounds. Pro-Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed 'all those aboard' a military vehicle targeted by the mortar fire. Helicopters reportedly landed in near the base on the next morning to evacuate wounded soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 3 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have attacked and killed three Ethiopian soldiers in the Diinsoor town area, Bay Region. An additional four soldiers were also wounded in the attack.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 4 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked AMISOM troops in Qoryoley town, located in the southern region of Lower Shabelle. According to the source, Al-Shabaab fighters were able to gain control of the town temporarily overnight, before pulling out the next morning. AMISOM troops later reported the event, claiming to have repelled the attack on their base and confirming to have killed two Al-Shabaab militiamen during the clashes.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 8 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Djiboutian) in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran region. The source mentioned that a medical helicopter later landed at the base to remove soldiers that were presumably injured in the attack. No fatalities were mentioned by the source.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed Kenyan forces traveling from Tabta/Qoqani headed to Dhobley at Dalbio area (c. 50 km east of Dhobley town - approx. coordinates used). The group claim to have killed and injured 15 soldiers. Fatalities coded as 7. The attack began with a bomb attack which was followed by an exchange of gunfire.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 30 September 2018: Joint Somali and Amisom clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters in Ber Hano (Beerxaano) and other villages on the outskirts of Belet Weyne. No info on casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 30 September 2018: Joint Somali and Amisom clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters in Ber Hano (Beerxaano) and other villages on the outskirts of Belet Weyne. No info on casualties.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 4 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a convoy of joint AMISOM and Somali National Army forces in Beerayabaal area (c. 20 km west of Halgan village). Gunfire ensued. No info on casualties.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 10 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters conducted a late-night attack against Somali soldiers and allied AMISOM troops (Identified by the source as Ugandan) in Qoryooley District in Lower Shabelle. No further info.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM troop base near the KM60 village neighborhood, Afgooye. Troops clashed with the fighters for about 30 minutes after which the perpetrators withdrew.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 13 October 2018: US-backed special force troops and AMISOM forces attacked Al-Shabaab positions in Basra, near Bal'ad town.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: On October 14, An AMISOM Uganda night patrol was ambushed by Al Shabaab in Marka town of Shabelle region. One soldier died and a civilian also lost life in the cross fire exchange. 11 militants were also reported to be killed. This event is believed to be distinct from earlier clashes in the town.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: On October 14, Al Shabaab ambushed and killed six AMISOM Burundian soldiers outside of Marka town, Shabeellaha Hoose. The Burundian soldiers were sent as reinforcements to Somalian Forces during clashes with Al Shabaab in Marka town (coded in a separate event).

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On October 19, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM troop position at Embareso neighborhood in Baraawe town, Shabelle region.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On October 19, Al Shabaab militants clashed with an AMISOM position at Danow settlement near Marka town, Shabelle region.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 22 October. Al-Shabab fighters and Somali government forces, backed by Ethiopia troops in the region, have clashed in areas of Hudur, Bakool region. The commanders added that government troops are now in control of the areas where the fighting happened, and that al-Shabab fighters have been pushed out.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 23 October. Government and Amisom troops captured the village of Fiidow in Middle Shabelle Region from al-Shabab. It had been under the militants' control since 2015.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 24 October. A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM and Somali government troops positioned outside Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle. There was heavy exchange of gunfire, and AS were forced to withdraw from the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 25 October. AMISOM confirmed the killing of the Chief Finance Controller of al Shabaab in an ambush in Barrire village.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 25 October. A commander, a chief finance controller of Al Shabaab and head of the Zakat tax collection in Lower Shabelle region were killed after AMISOM troops ambushed a venue of an Al Shabaab meeting in Bariire.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 31 October. A group of Al-Shabab fighters attacked AMISOM troops at Danow, Qoryoley district. The two allegedly exchanged gun fire before the attackers were forced to withdraw.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 28 November. Al Shabaab militants ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving along Shalambood road at El-Waregow village. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 04 December. A RCIED, planted by the roadside by AS, targeting an AMISOM convoy, detonated in Heliwa district. AMISOM soldiers reacted with gunfire. No reports of casualties.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

ACTOR1: Lou Nuer Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Up to 8,000 members of the Lou Nuer militia raided villages in Pibor county to attack members of the Murle tribe, reportedly recovering dozens of abducted children and thousands of cattle stolen in August. No report of causalities, though there has been many since their fighting began in June 2011. SPLA and UNMISS allegedly sent reinforcements to Pibor to repel the attackers, however fighting continued. 30 reported killed.

ACTOR1: Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
NOTES: At least 29 killed over two days inside UN protection site in Malakal after fighting between Dinka and Shilluk displaced communities. UNMISS police used tear gas. Fatalitiies included 3 MSF staff. During fighting between Dinka and Shilluk militia, SPLA soldiers entered camp on night of Feb 18 and attacked Shilluk and Nuer IDPs, burning tents and killing civilians. Fatalities reported are result of both Dinka-Shilluk fighting and by military violence against civilians. Therefore, 10 fatalities coded for Feb 17 battle, 10 coded for Feb 18 battle, and 9 coded for Feb 18 violence against civilians.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Around 16 December 2020 (week of), UNMISS clashed with six gunmen who were attempting to loot an NGO compound in Leer town (Unity state). Police subsequently engaged the gunmen, and advanced alongside UNMISS forces (who appear to have provided police with transportation in an UNMISS APC) to pursue the gunmen. During the pursuit, UNMISS and police engaged a second armed group, whom they recovered 12 cows from. No injuries or fatalities occurred.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fire three shot at UNAMID personnel in Tullus. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Clashes between UNAMID troops and 40 Zaghawa militia attempting to steal cattle and vehicles on the road between Kass and Shangita, 86km west of Nyala. 5 killed.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNAMID patrol travelling from Nyala attacked by gunmen near Kas. 4 peacekeepers injured.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Gunfire between unknown armed group and UNAMID patrol in Bowa Turmes village, 18kms northwest of UNAMIDs site in Kutum. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of South Africa (1994-); WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: South African soldier from UNAMID killed and 1 injured in ambush by unknown group on road between Mellit and Almaliha.

ACTOR1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: SLM/AW attacked a UNAMID patrol 31km north east of Kutum. UNAMID killed 1 and injured 2 SLA/AW members. 5 weapons were seized.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Armed group attacked UNAMID peacekeeping soldiers in Anka. One injured, weapons seized.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified armed group attacked a UNAMID patrol in El Daein, hijacking the vehicle.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: Unknown group fired on a WFP relief convoy en route from Kutum to Kabkabia, 40km from Kutum. UNAMID soldiers from South Africa fought back. 1 peacekeeper killed, 1 attacker killed.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen opened fire on a commercial pickup vehicle in Kolom area transporting traders from Warrap State, South Sudan, to the common market at Noong, Abyei, killing three and wounding two seriously. The gunmen also exchanged fire with a UNISFA patrol responding to the incident, which later arrested two suspects.

ACTOR1: Hamid Ali Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019); UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy shooting erupted when government forces prevented members of the Hamid Ali militia from entering Zalingei to protest delays in salary payment. During the violence, one member of the Arab militia was killed and three stray bullets hit UNAMID facilities, without injuring peacekeepers.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNHCR: United Nations Refugee Agency
NOTES: On 3 May, armed men in military attire on board a Toyota Land Cruiser vehicle attempted to carjack a minibus belonging to the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees near the World Food Programme warehouse in Nyala. The perpetrators fled the scene following the intervention of UNAMID troops escorting the vehicle. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen shot and kille a Nigerian UNAMID soldier in downtown Nyala, South Darfur. The assailants left with his vehicle.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 30 June, an unknown armed assailant raided 43 cattle belonging to a Misseriya herder at Sink, in Sector North of Abyei. The assailant killed one person and injured another. UNISFA troops were dispatched to the area and exchanged fire with the assailant, who abandoned the cattle and fled. The cattle were handed over to the Misseriya owner.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On June 28th, unidentified gunmen fired at a UNIFSA patrol at Gung Garang in the Central Sector of Abyei. There were no injuries.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On July 16th, unknown gunmen attacked Amiet Market (Abyei) killing six civilians, including a baby, and looting a small number of cattle. A UNSIFA patrol intervened, and the gunmen killed one peacekeeper and seriously wounded another. Subsequent reports imply the attackers were cattle raiders from South Sudan, and have been coded as such.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On August 19th, armed youths attacked a UNIFSA patrol (who appear to have been attempting to also arrest a suspect) at Dari market in the Northern Sector of Abyei (coordinates for Diffra, Abyei area, used at prec2). One peacekeeper was injured and a Misseriya man killed during the clash.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 18 March 2020, an unknown armed man fired five shots at a UNISFA military observer patrol near Goli in the disputed Abyei area. One of the observers was wounded by shards from the vehicle window, after it was hit by a bullet.

ACTOR1: Misseriya Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 24 April 2020, Misseriya militiamen attacked UNISFA peacekeepers at Alal in the disputed Abyei area. UNISFA killed two Misseriya between this and another attack the same day at Nainai (fatalities distributed evenly across two events).

ACTOR1: Misseriya Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 24 April 2020, Misseriya militiamen attacked UNISFA peacekeepers in the vicinity of Nainai in the disputed Abyei area. UNISFA killed two Misseriya between this and another attack the same day at Alal (fatalities distributed evenly across two events).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 12 May 2020, an unspecified group attacked members of UNISFA Force Protection assigned to protect members of the Joint Border Verification and Monitoring Mechanism, as they travelled from Kadugli to Murta (South Kordofan state). The UNISFA vehicle was damaged, but no injuries occurred.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 24 June 2020, unknown attackers fired upon a UNISFA vehicle in between Goli and Todach in the disputed Abyei area (coordinates for intermediate location of Thothok used at GP2), wounding three soldiers (one seriously). The attack comes amid deteriorating security in the area.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 2 December 2020, an unspecified armed group clashed with UNISFA peacekeepers close to Doungab in the disputed Abyei (approximate coordinates based on UNISFA map used at GP2), after the armed group fired upon the peacekeepers. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: On 1 January 2021, unidentified militiamen attempted to break into the UNAMID compound in Zalingei (Central Darfur state), and are described as having ''besieged'' the premises (reportedly in a bid to loot material from the outgoing mission). There is no further information at this time.

ACTOR1: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: MONUC destroy 2 UPC camps at Niamamba, Lake Albert, killing 2 and capturing 30.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Yemen)
ACTOR2: UNMHA: United Nations Mission to Support the Hodeidah Agreement (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UN: United Nations
NOTES: On 17 January, unidentified armed forces reportedly opened the fire on the UNMHA Redeployment Coordination Committee (RCC) team in 50th street in the northeast of Al Hudaydah city, injuring a civilian tractor driver and several members of the security crew. Both pro-Houthi forces and anti-Houthi forces blamed the opposite faction for the incident.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
ACTOR2: UNMHA: United Nations Mission to Support the Hodeidah Agreement (2019-)
NOTES: Houthi forces reportedly fired at the UN team that observes the ceasefire in Hodeidah, firing on their positions in Hudaydah and preventing them from reaching the Red Sea Mills area. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: National Resistance Forces
ACTOR2: UNMHA: United Nations Mission to Support the Hodeidah Agreement (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UN: United Nations
NOTES: On 2 March, anti-Houthi forces reportedly opened fire at the convoy of the head of the UNMHA RCC team, Michael Lollesgaard, while passing in 50 street, north of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen. 2 bulldozers were reportedly damaged by the attack. No injuries nor fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMHA: United Nations Mission to Support the Hodeidah Agreement (2019-)
LOCATION: Al Hudaydah - Al Yamani Dairy Factory
NOTES: On December 13, pro-Houthi forces reportedly fired calibre 14.5mm and 12.7mm weapons and sniper shots at the City Max Joint Observation Post (coded 500 metres from Al Yamani Dairy Factory), injuring a soldier working for the supply of liaison officers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
ACTOR2: UNMHA: United Nations Mission to Support the Hodeidah Agreement (2019-)
NOTES: On 24 January 2020, pro-Houthi snipers reportedly opened fire on an UNMHA support vehicle in Al Khamiri area of Al Hudaydah city (Al Hali, Al Hudaydah). No fatalities nor injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
ACTOR2: UNMHA: United Nations Mission to Support the Hodeidah Agreement (2019-)
LOCATION: Al Hudaydah - Al Yamani Dairy Factory
NOTES: On 22 February 2020, pro-Houthi forces stationing in Yemen Mobile Roundabout area (Al Hali, Al Hudaydah) reportedly fired sniper shots at a military vehicle belonging to the UNMHA monitoring team in City Max area [Al Yamani Dairy Factory] (Al Hali, Al Hudaydah). No fatalities nor injuries reported.
